translated: In the case of root, there are three; in the case of object, there are nine; in the case of predominance, there are nine; in the case of proximity, there are nine; in the case of contiguity, there are nine; in the case of immediate contiguity, there are nine; in the case of arising together, there are nine; in the case of conascence, there are nine; in the case of mutuality, there are nine; in the case of support, there are nine; in the case of dependence, there are nine; in the case of decisive support, there are nine; in the case of nutriment, there are three; in the case of faculty, there are nine; in the case of path, there are nine; in the case of association, there are nine; in the case of presence, there are nine; in the case of absence, there are nine; in the case of disappearance, there are nine; in the case of non-disappearance, there are nine.

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: The Reversal of the Pairs

original: Hetu kusalo dhammo hetussa kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu kusalaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A wholesome root is a condition, by way of object condition, for a wholesome root. … It is a condition, by way of decisive support condition, for a wholesome root. … three.

original: Nahetu kusalo dhammo nahetussa kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena🔽paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo. Nahetu kusalo dhammo hetussa kusalassa dhammassa
analyzed: na hetu kusalaḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena  paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ na hetu kusalaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa kusalassa dhammassa
translated: An uncaused wholesome state is related to an uncaused wholesome state as object condition … as co-nascence condition …🔽as support condition. An uncaused wholesome state is related to a caused wholesome state as object condition … as co-nascence condition … as support condition.

original: ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo.🔽Nahetu kusalo dhammo hetussa kusalassa ca nahetussa kusalassa ca dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena🔽paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ  na hetu kusalaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa kusalassa ca na hetussa kusalassa ca dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena  paccayo sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An uncaused wholesome state is related to a caused wholesome state and to an uncaused wholesome state as object condition … as co-nascence condition … as support condition.

original: Hetu kusalo ca nahetu kusalo ca dhammā hetussa kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu kusalo ca na hetu kusalo ca dhammā hetussa kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo sahajāta paccayena paccayo upanissaya paccayena paccayo  tīṇi
translated: A caused wholesome state and an uncaused wholesome state are related to a caused wholesome state as object condition … as co-nascence condition … as support condition … three.

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava, naadhipatiyā nava …pe… noavigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ, paccanīyaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava na adhipatiyā nava pe no avigate nava saṅkhitta paccanīya
translated: In the section on cause, there are nine in the non-cause, nine in the non-object, nine in the non-dominance, etc. (In reverse order: nine in the non-root, nine in the non-path, nine in the non-non-causally-related-to-the-arising-of-another-state, nine in the non-non-decisive-support, nine in the non-non-kamma-result, nine in the non-non-nutriment, nine in the non-non-faculty, nine in the non-non-pre-nascence, nine in the non-non-decisive-support-nascence, nine in the non-non-jhana, nine in the non-non-path, nine in the non-non-non-causally-related-to-the-arising-of-another-state, nine in the non-non-retribution, nine in the non-non-clinging.)

translated: With root-cause as condition, not object: three … With non-causality as condition, object: nine … With non-causality as condition, not object: nine … With non-causality as condition, object and not object: nine. (In brief, in reverse order.)🔽With non-root-cause as condition, object: nine … With non-root-cause as condition, not object: nine … With non-root-cause as condition, object and not object: nine. translated: An unwholesome state without root-cause is related to an unwholesome state without root-cause as a jhāna condition … there are three. In the section on contiguity, there are nine. In the section on presence, there are nine. In the section on absence, there are nine. In the section on disappearance, there are nine. In the section on non-disappearance, there are nine.

original: tīṇi, indriye tīṇi, jhāne tīṇi, magge tīṇi, sampayutte nava, atthiyā nava, natthiyā
analyzed: tīṇi indriye tīṇi jhāne tīṇi magge tīṇi sampayutte nava atthiyā nava natthiyā
translated: In the section on cause, there are three. In the section on nutriment, there are three. In the section on faculty, there are three. In the section on path, there are three. In the section on association, there are nine. In the section on presence, there are nine. In the section on absence, there are nine.

original: nava, vigate nava, avigate nava.
analyzed: nava vigate nava avigate nava
translated: In the section on disappearance, there are nine. In the section on non-disappearance, there are nine.

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: The reverse order

original: Hetu akusalo dhammo hetussa akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu akusalaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: An unwholesome state with root-cause is related to an unwholesome state with root-cause as object condition … as co-nascence condition … as support condition …

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare nava, nasamanantare nava, nasahajāte nava, naaññamaññe nava …pe… noavigate nava. (Paccanīyaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava na adhipatiyā nava na anantare nava na samanantare nava na sahajāte nava na aññamaññe nava pe no avigate nava paccanīya
translated: With non-cause as condition, there are nine. With non-object as condition, there are nine. With non-dominance as condition, there are nine. With non-antecedent as condition, there are nine. With non-consequent as condition, there are nine. With non-co-nascence as condition, there are nine. With non-conascence as condition, there are nine. With non-purity as condition, there are nine. With non-development as condition, there are nine. With non-possession as condition, there are nine. With non-deprivation as condition, there are nine. (The reverse order.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ, anulomapaccanīyaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi saṅkhitta anuloma paccanīya
translated: With cause as condition, with non-object as condition, there are three. (The direct order and the reverse order.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ, paccanīyānulomaṁ.)🔽(Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇe nava  yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: With non-cause as condition, with object as condition, there are nine. (The reverse order and the direct order.)

original: 3.1.1.3. Abyākatapada
analyzed: a byākata pada
translated: (As in the case of the Triad of the Wholesome, the method of working out the permutations should be understood in the case of the Triad of the Unwholesome, the Triad of the Neither-Unwholesome-Nor-Wholesome, the Dyad of the Unwholesome, the Dyad of the Neither-Unwholesome-Nor-Wholesome, and the Dyad of the Neither-Greed-Nor-Hatred-Rooted, in each case according to the method of the Triad of the Wholesome.)🔽The Undetermined Category

original: 3.1.1.3.1–6 Paṭiccādivāra

translated: Cause🔽An unwholesome root is a condition, as cause condition, for a resultant unprofitable formation. translated: An unwholesome root is a condition, as cause condition, for a resultant unprofitable consciousness and for the states associated therewith and for the mental factors that are invariably associated therewith. translated: An unwholesome root is a condition, as object condition, for an unwholesome root and for a resultant unprofitable formation and for a functional unprofitable formation. translated: An unwholesome thought is a condition, as predominance condition, for an unwholesome thought.🔽An unwholesome thought is a condition, as predominance condition, for an unwholesome root.🔽An unwholesome root and an unwholesome thought are conditions, as predominance condition, for an unwholesome thought.

original: Nahetu abyākato dhammo nahetussa abyākatassa dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Hetu abyākato dhammo nahetussa abyākatassa dhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: na hetu abyākataḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa abyākatassa dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  hetu abyākataḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa abyākatassa dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An unwholesome root and an unwholesome thought are conditions, as predominance condition, for an unwholesome root.🔽An unwholesome root is a condition, as predominance condition, for an unwholesome thought.🔽An unwholesome thought is a condition, as predominance condition, for an unwholesome thought.🔽An unwholesome thought is a condition, as predominance condition, for an unwholesome root.🔽An unwholesome root and an unwholesome thought are conditions, as predominance condition, for an unwholesome thought.

original: Nahetu abyākato dhammo nahetussa abyākatassa dhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: na hetu abyākataḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa abyākatassa dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An unwholesome root and an unwholesome thought are conditions, as predominance condition, for an unwholesome root.

original: Hetu abyākato ca nahetu abyākato ca dhammā nahetussa abyākatassa dhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: hetu abyākataḥ ca na hetu abyākataḥ ca dhammā na hetussa abyākatassa dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An unwholesome root and a neutral factor that is not a root are a condition, as a condition arising after, for a neutral factor that is not a root.

original: Nahetu abyākato dhammo nahetussa abyākatassa dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetu abyākataḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa abyākatassa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A neutral factor that is not a root is a condition, as a kamma condition, for a neutral factor that is not a root. … There are three.

original: Hetu abyākato dhammo hetussa abyākatassa dhammassa vipākapaccayena paccayo … nava.
analyzed: hetu abyākataḥ dhammaḥ hetussa abyākatassa dhammassa vipāka paccayena paccayaḥ nava
translated: A neutral unwholesome root is a condition, as a kamma condition, for a neutral unwholesome root. … There are nine.

original: Nahetu abyākato dhammo nahetussa abyākatassa dhammassa āhārapaccayena paccayo … indriyapaccayena
analyzed: na hetu abyākataḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa abyākatassa dhammassa āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ indriya paccayena
translated: A neutral factor that is not a root is a condition, as a nutriment condition, for a neutral factor that is not a root. … as a faculty condition …

original: paccayo … jhānapaccayena paccayo … maggapaccayena paccayo … sampayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ jhāna paccayena paccayaḥ magga paccayena paccayaḥ sampayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: as a jhāna condition … as a path condition … as a association condition.

original: Vippayutta🔽Hetu abyākato dhammo nahetussa abyākatassa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: vippayutta  hetu abyākataḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa abyākatassa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Dissociated🔽A neutral unwholesome root is a condition, as a dissociation condition, for a neutral factor that is not a root.

original: Nahetu abyākato dhammo nahetussa abyākatassa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetu abyākataḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa abyākatassa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A neutral factor that is not a root is a condition, as a dissociation condition, for a neutral factor that is not a root. … There are three.

original: Hetu abyākato ca nahetu abyākato ca dhammā nahetussa abyākatassa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu abyākataḥ ca na hetu abyākataḥ ca dhammā na hetussa abyākatassa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo saṅkhitta
translated: Factors that are a condition, as condition, for a causally arisen unwholesome consciousness element and for the materiality originated by that consciousness element.🔽In the case of the causally arisen unwholesome consciousness element, there are three kinds of conditions, namely, object condition, predominance condition, and support condition.🔽In the case of the materiality originated by that consciousness element, there are three kinds of conditions, namely, object condition, predominance condition, and support condition.

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte🔽nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi, pacchājāte tīṇi,🔽āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi, vipāke nava, āhāre tīṇi, indriye nava, jhāne tīṇi, magge
analyzed: tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte  nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte tīṇi  āsevane nava kamme tīṇi vipāke nava āhāre tīṇi indriye nava jhāne tīṇi magge
translated: In the case of the causally arisen unwholesome consciousness element, there are three kinds of conditions, namely, object condition, predominance condition, and support condition.🔽In the case of the materiality originated by that consciousness element, there are three kinds of conditions, namely, object condition, predominance condition, and support condition.🔽In the case of the causally arisen unwholesome consciousness element, there are three kinds of conditions, namely, object condition, predominance condition, and support condition.🔽In the case of the materiality originated by that consciousness element, there are three kinds of conditions, namely, object condition, predominance condition, and support condition.🔽In the case of the causally arisen unwholesome consciousness element, there are three kinds of conditions, namely, object condition, predominance condition, and support condition.

original: nava, sampayutte nava, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā nava, natthiyā nava, vigate nava, avigate nava.🔽Paccanīyuddhāra🔽Hetu abyākato dhammo hetussa abyākatassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: nava sampayutte nava vippayutte pañca atthiyā nava natthiyā nava vigate nava avigate nava  paccanīya uddhāra  hetu abyākataḥ dhammaḥ hetussa abyākatassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena
translated: In the case of the materiality originated by that consciousness element, there are three kinds of conditions, namely, object condition, predominance condition, and support condition.🔽In the case of the causally arisen unwholesome consciousness element, there are three kinds of conditions, namely, object condition, predominance condition, and support condition.🔽In the case of the materiality originated by that consciousness element, there are three kinds of conditions, namely, object condition, predominance condition, and support condition.🔽In the case of the causally arisen unwholesome consciousness element, there are three kinds of conditions, namely, object condition, predominance condition, and support condition.🔽In the case of the materiality originated by that consciousness element, there are three kinds of conditions, namely, object condition, predominance condition, and support condition.🔽In the case of the causally arisen unwholesome consciousness element, there are three kinds of conditions, namely, object condition, predominance condition, and support condition.

original: paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo. Hetu abyākato dhammo nahetussa abyākatassa
analyzed: paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ hetu abyākataḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa abyākatassa
translated: In the case of the materiality originated by that consciousness element, there are three kinds of conditions, namely, object condition, predominance condition, and support condition.🔽In the case of the causally arisen unwholesome consciousness element, there are three kinds of conditions,

original: dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena🔽paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo. Hetu abyākato dhammo hetussa abyākatassa ca
analyzed: dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena  paccayaḥ pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ hetu abyākataḥ dhammaḥ hetussa abyākatassa ca
translated: … is related to a dhamma that is related to a condition as object as condition … is related to a dhamma that is related to a condition as arising together as condition … is related to a dhamma that is related to a condition as support as condition …

original: nahetussa abyākatassa ca dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: na hetussa abyākatassa ca dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena
translated: is related to a dhamma that is related to a condition as arising later as condition. A cause that is indeterminate is related to a cause that is indeterminate …

original: paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: is related to a cause that is indeterminate and to that which is not a cause that is indeterminate …

original: Nahetu abyākato dhammo nahetussa abyākatassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo🔽… sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: na hetu abyākataḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa abyākatassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A dhamma that is not a cause that is indeterminate is related to a dhamma that is not a cause that is indeterminate as condition being a condition by way of object …🔽is related by way of arising together … is related by way of support … is related by way of prenascence …

original: … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … āhārapaccayena paccayo … indriyapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ indriya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: is related by way of postnascence … is related by way of nutriment … is related by way of faculty.

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava, naadhipatiyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ, paccanīyaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava na adhipatiyā nava saṅkhitta paccanīya
translated: (In reverse order:) In the non-cause nine, in the non-object nine, in the non-dominance nine. (In brief.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ, anulomapaccanīyaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi saṅkhitta anuloma paccanīya
translated: In the condition being a cause, in the non-object three. (In brief, in the direct and reverse order.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ, paccanīyānulomaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇe nava
translated: With no condition of root cause, nine in object. (In brief, in reverse order.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: (Just as the questions in the Skillful Triad were calculated in forward order, in reverse order, in forward and reverse order, and in reverse and forward order, so should it be calculated here.)

original: Hetudukakusalattikaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.🔽3.1.2. Hetuduka, Vedanāttika
analyzed: hetu duka kusala ttikam niṭṭhita
translated: The Triad with Dual Roots is finished.🔽The Triad with Feeling🔽The Terms Associated with Pleasant Feeling

original: 3.1.2.1. Sukhāyavedanāyasampayuttapada🔽3.1.2.1.1–6 Paṭiccādivāra
analyzed: sukha āya vedanāya sampayutta pada
translated: … The Section on Conditionality

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The Four Conditions

original: Hetu🔽Hetuṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetuṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca
analyzed: hetu  hetum sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetum sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca
translated: Root Cause🔽A root-cause that is associated with pleasant feeling is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a phenomenon that is associated with pleasant feeling.🔽A root-cause that is associated with pleasant feeling is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a phenomenon that is not associated with pleasant feeling.

original: nahetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetuṁ sukhāya vedanāya🔽sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca nahetu sukhāya vedanāya
analyzed: na hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetum sukhāya vedanāya 🔽sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ ca na hetu sukhāya vedanāya
translated: A root-cause that is associated with pleasant feeling is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a phenomenon that is associated with pleasant feeling and for a phenomenon that is not associated with pleasant feeling.

original: sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: sampayuttaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: and associated with causes.

original: Nahetuṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nahetuṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nahetuṁ sukhāya vedanāya
analyzed: na hetum sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na hetum sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca  hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na hetum sukhāya vedanāya
translated: Conditioned by a state unaccompanied by causes that is connected with pleasant feeling, a state unaccompanied by causes that is connected with pleasant feeling …🔽… a state accompanied by causes that is connected with pleasant feeling …🔽… a state accompanied by causes that is connected with pleasant feeling and a state unaccompanied by causes that is connected with pleasant feeling …

original: sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca nahetu sukhāya vedanāya🔽sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Hetuṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca nahetuṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetuṁ sukhāya
analyzed: sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ ca na hetu sukhāya vedanāya  sampayuttaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā  hetum sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam ca na hetum sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam ca dhamma  paṭicca hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetum sukhāya
translated: … a state accompanied by causes that is connected with pleasant feeling and a state unaccompanied by causes that is connected with pleasant feeling …🔽… a state unaccompanied by causes that is connected with pleasant feeling …🔽… a state accompanied by causes that is connected with pleasant feeling and a state unaccompanied by causes that is connected with pleasant feeling …

original: vedanāya sampayuttañca nahetuṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu
analyzed: vedanāya sampayuttam ca na hetum sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam ca dhammam paṭicca na hetu
translated: … a state accompanied by causes that is connected with pleasant feeling and a state unaccompanied by causes that is connected with pleasant feeling …

original: sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetuṁ sukhāya vedanāya🔽sampayuttañca nahetuṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu sukhāya
analyzed: sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetum sukhāya vedanāya  sampayuttam ca na hetum sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam ca dhammam paṭicca hetu sukhāya
translated: A factor associated with pleasant feeling …🔽A factor associated with pleasant feeling that is a cause and a factor not associated with pleasant feeling …

original: vedanāya sampayutto ca nahetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: vedanāya sampayutto ca na hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: Factors associated with pleasant feeling that are causes and factors not associated with pleasant feeling associated with pleasant feeling …

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte
translated: (In brief:) Nine in the cause, nine in the object, nine in the predominance, nine in the proximity, nine in the contiguity,

original: nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, purejāte nava, āsevane nava,
analyzed: nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava purejāte nava āsevane nava
translated: nine in the immediate proximity, nine in the repetition, nine in the repetition condition, nine in the past, nine in the future,

original: kamme nava, vipāke nava, āhāre nava …pe… avigate nava. (Anulomaṁ.)
analyzed: kamme nava vipāke nava āhāre nava pe avigate nava anuloma
translated: nine in the present, nine in the internal, nine in the external, nine in the external, nine in the unclassified. (In the regular progression.)

original: Nahetu-naadhipati
analyzed: na hetunā adhipati
translated: Not a cause, not a predominance,

original: Nahetuṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā.
analyzed: na hetum sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā
translated: A factor not associated with pleasant feeling that is not a cause …

original: Hetuṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto🔽dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā. Hetuṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽nahetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā nava, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte nava. analyzed: hetum sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati na adhipati paccayā hetum sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca  na hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na adhipati paccayā  na hetuyā eka na adhipatiyā nava na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na jhāne eka na magge eka na vippayutte nava paccanīya  hetu paccayā na adhipatiyā nava saṅkhitta anuloma paccanīya  na hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇe eka saṅkhitta paccanīya anuloma
translated: With a cause that is associated with pleasant feeling as condition, a cause that is not associated with pleasant feeling …🔽(In brief.)

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo hetussa sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A cause that is associated with pleasant feeling is a condition, as cause condition, for a cause that is associated with pleasant feeling … for three.

original: Ārammaṇādi🔽Hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo hetussa sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Nahetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo nahetussa sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.

analyzed: hetu sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttassa dhammassa

analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava pe no avigate nava paccanīya
translated: With respect to not a cause nine, with respect to not an object nine … (Reversing the method.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ, anulomapaccanīyaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi saṅkhitta anuloma paccanīya

analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba  dukkha āya vedanāya sampayutta pada

original: 3.1.2.2.1–6 Paṭiccādivāra

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The Fourfold Dependent Origination

original: Hetu🔽Hetuṁ dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetuṁ dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca
analyzed: hetu  hetum dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca hetu dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetum dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca
translated: Cause🔽A causally-related state associated with painful feeling is homogeneous with a causally-related state associated with painful feeling and arises with it as root-cause.

original: nahetu dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetuṁ dukkhāya🔽vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca nahetu

translated: A causally-related state associated with painful feeling is homogeneous with a causally-related state not associated with painful feeling and arises with it as root-cause.

original: dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.

translated: A causally-related state associated with painful feeling is homogeneous with a causally-related state associated with painful feeling and with a causally-related state not associated with painful feeling and arises with it as root-cause.

original: Nahetuṁ dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetum dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na hetu dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With non-cause as condition, a non-cause that is associated with painful feeling … (three times, omitting the last two sections.)

original: Hetuṁ dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca nahetuṁ dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. analyzed: hetum dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca na hetum dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttañca dhammam paṭicca hetu dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte  nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava purejāte nava āsevane nava
translated: With cause and non-cause that are associated with painful feeling as condition, a cause that is associated with painful feeling … (three times, omitting the last two sections.)

translated: In the section on cause, there are nine. In the section on object, there are nine. In the section on predominance, there are nine. In the section on proximity, there are nine. In the section on contiguity, there are nine. In the section on presence, there are nine.

original: nava, vippayutte nava, atthiyā nava, natthiyā nava, vigate nava, avigate nava. (Anulomaṁ.)🔽Nahetu-naadhipati

translated: In the section on absence, there are nine. In the section on disappearance, there are nine. In the section on non-disappearance, there are nine. (In the forward order.)🔽With non-cause and non-predominance …

translated: With non-cause as condition, a non-cause that is associated with painful feeling arises.

analyzed: hetum dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca hetu dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na adhipati paccayā  na hetuyā eka na adhipatiyā nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na jhāne eka na magge eka paccanīya  hetu paccayā na adhipatiyā nava saṅkhitta anuloma paccanīya  na hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇe eka saṅkhitta paccanīya anuloma
translated: With cause as condition, a cause that is associated with painful feeling arises. (In brief.)

translated: A cause that is associated with painful feeling is related to a cause that is associated with painful feeling as a cause condition. A cause that is associated with painful feeling is related to a cause that is associated with painful feeling and to a cause that is not associated with painful feeling as a cause condition.

translated: A state that is not a root and is related to a neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling is related to a state that is not a root and is related to a neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling as kamma-result … as nutriment … as faculty … as jhāna … as path … as association … as non-disappearance.🔽A state that is a root and is related to a neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling is related to a state that is a root and is related to a neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling as kamma-result … as nutriment … as faculty … as jhāna … as path … as association … as non-disappearance.🔽There are three kinds of root as condition. There are nine kinds of immediacy as condition.🔽There are nine kinds of repetition as condition. There are three kinds of kamma as condition. There are nine kinds of nutriment as condition. There are nine kinds of faculty as condition. There are nine kinds of jhāna as condition. There are nine kinds of path as condition. There are nine kinds of association as condition. There are nine kinds of non-disappearance as condition. There are nine kinds of disappearance as condition.

original: nava, āhāre tīṇi, indriye nava, jhāne tīṇi, magge nava, sampayutte nava, atthiyā🔽nava, natthiyā nava, vigate nava, avigate nava. (Anulomaṁ.)

translated: A state that is not a root and is related to neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling is related to a state that is not a root and is related to neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling as kamma-result … as nutriment … as faculty … as jhāna … as path … as association … as presence … as non-disappearance.

original: Hetuṁ vipākadhammadhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu vipākadhammadhammo uppajjati nakammapaccayā.🔽Nahetuṁ vipākadhammadhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu vipākadhammadhammo uppajjati nakammapaccayā.
analyzed: hetum vipāka dhamma dhammam paṭicca na hetu vipāka dhamma dhammo uppajjati na kamma paccayā  na hetum vipāka dhamma dhammam paṭicca na hetu vipāka dhamma dhammo uppajjati na kamma paccayā
translated: With an object that is not a cause and has results, there is an object that is not a cause and has results. (The rest are condensed.)

original: Hetuṁ vipākadhammadhammañca nahetuṁ vipākadhammadhammañca paṭicca nahetu vipākadhammadhammo uppajjati nakammapaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetum vipāka dhamma dhammañca na hetum vipāka dhamma dhammañca paṭicca na hetu vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ uppajjati na kamma paccayā
translated: With an object that is a cause and has results and an object that is not a cause and has results, there is an object that is not a cause and has results. (The rest are condensed.)

original: Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā nava, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, navippayutte nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ, paccanīyaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā eka na adhipatiyā nava na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na vippayutte nava saṅkhitta paccanīya
translated: With an object that is not a cause, there is one. With an object that is not a condition by way of predominance, there are nine. With an object that is not a condition by way of prior, there are nine. With an object that is not a condition by way of subsequent, there are nine. With an object that is not a condition by way of nutriment, there are nine. With an object that is not a condition by way of kamma, there are three. With an object that is not a condition by way of result, there are nine. With an object that is not a condition by way of association, there are nine. (The rest are condensed.)

original: Hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ, anulomapaccanīyaṁ.)🔽Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ, paccanīyānulomaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayā na adhipatiyā nava saṅkhitta anuloma paccanīya 🔽na hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇe eka saṅkhitta paccanīya anuloma
translated: With a condition that is a cause, there are nine that are not conditions by way of predominance. (The rest are condensed.)🔽With a condition that is not a cause, there is one that is an object. (The rest are condensed.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi paccayavāropi nissayavāropi saṁsaṭṭhavāropi sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāraḥ api paccaya vāraḥ api nissaya vāraḥ api sa saṭṭha vāraḥ api sampayutta vāraḥ api paṭicca vāra sadisā vitthāretabbā
translated: (The section on origination should be elaborated in the same way as the section on condition.)

original: Hetvādi
analyzed: hetu ādi
translated: Cause, etc.

original: Hetu vipākadhammadhammo hetussa vipākadhammadhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ hetussa vipāka dhamma dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A cause that is a state subject to cankers is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a state subject to cankers that is a result. … There are three.

original: Hetu vipākadhammadhammo hetussa vipākadhammadhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … nava.
analyzed: hetu vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ hetussa vipāka dhamma dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ nava
translated: A cause that is a state subject to cankers is a condition, as object condition, for a state subject to cankers that is a result. … There are nine.

original: Hetu vipākadhammadhammo hetussa vipākadhammadhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati … nava.
analyzed: hetu vipāka dhamma dhammo hetussa vipāka dhamma dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati nava
translated: A cause that is a state subject to cankers is a condition, as prenascence condition, for a state subject to cankers that is a result. … There are nine.

original: Hetu vipākadhammadhammo hetussa vipākadhammadhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo …pe…
analyzed: hetu vipāka dhamma dhammo hetussa vipāka dhamma dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ pe
translated: A cause that is a state subject to cankers is a condition, as proximity condition, for a state subject to cankers that is a result. …

original: upanissayapaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇūpanissayo, anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo
analyzed: upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ
translated: A cause that is a state subject to cankers is a condition, as decisive-support condition, for a state subject to cankers that is a result. There are four kinds of decisive-support condition: the support decisive-support, the proximate decisive-support, the natural decisive-support, and the acquired decisive-support.

original: … nava … āsevanapaccayena paccayo … nava.
analyzed: nava āsevana paccayena paccayaḥ nava
translated: … There are nine. A cause that is a state subject to cankers is a condition, as repetition condition, for a state subject to cankers that is a result. … There are nine.

original: Nahetu vipākadhammadhammo nahetussa vipākadhammadhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetu vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ na hetussa vipāka dhamma dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A state that is not a root and is a resultant phenomenon is related to a state that is not a root and is a resultant phenomenon as the kamma condition. … There are three.

original: Nahetu vipākadhammadhammo nahetussa vipākadhammadhammassa āhārapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ na hetussa vipāka dhamma dhammassa āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: A state that is not a root and is a resultant phenomenon is related to a state that is not a root and is a resultant phenomenon as the nutriment condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte🔽nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi, āhāre
analyzed: tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte  nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava āsevane nava kamme tīṇi āhāre
translated: As root, three; as object, nine; as predominance, nine; as proximity, nine; as contiguity, nine; as repetition, nine;

original: tīṇi, indriye nava, jhāne tīṇi, magge nava, sampayutte nava, atthiyā nava, natthiyā
analyzed: tīṇi indriye nava jhāne tīṇi magge nava sampayutte nava atthiyā nava natthiyā
translated: as dependence, nine; as association, nine; as dissociation, nine; as presence, nine; as absence, nine;

original: nava, vigate nava, avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ, anulomaṁ.)
analyzed: nava vigate nava avigate nava saṅkhitta anuloma
translated: as disappearance, nine; as non-disappearance, nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: The reverse order

original: Hetu vipākadhammadhammo hetussa vipākadhammadhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu vipāka dhamma dhammo hetussa vipāka dhamma dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: A state that is a root and is a resultant phenomenon is related to a state that is a root and is a resultant phenomenon as the object condition, as the condition being present together, and as the condition being proximate. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ, paccanīyaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta paccanīya
translated: With non-cause as condition, there are nine. (In brief, the reverse.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ, anulomapaccanīyaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi saṅkhitta anuloma paccanīya
translated: With cause as condition, non-object, there are three. (In brief, the direct-and-reverse.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ, paccanīyānulomaṁ.)🔽(Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇe nava  yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: With non-cause as condition, object, there are nine. (In brief, the reverse-and-direct.)🔽(As in the case of the three wholesome kinds of consciousness, the fourfold method should be worked out in detail in the case of the remaining kinds of consciousness.)🔽… neither result nor a resultant nor a state with result

original: 3.1.3.3. Nevavipākanavipākadhammapada🔽3.1.3.3.1–6 Paṭiccādivāra
analyzed: na iva vipāka na vipāka dhamma pada
translated: … the section on direct and reverse order

original: Paccayacatukka🔽1.3.3.7. Pañhāvāra
analyzed: paccaya catukka  pañhāvāra
translated: The fourfold dependent origination🔽… the question section

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The fourfold dependent origination

original: Hetu🔽Hetuṁ nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paṭicca hetu nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu  hetum neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paṭicca hetu neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: Cause🔽With a cause that is neither result nor a state with result as condition, there arises a cause that is neither result nor a state with result. (Three triplets.)

original: Nahetuṁ nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetum neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paṭicca na hetu neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With a cause that is not a cause and is neither result nor a state with result as condition, there arises a cause that is not a cause and is neither result nor a state with result. (Three triplets.)

original: Hetuṁ nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammañca nahetuṁ nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammañca paṭicca hetu nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetum neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammañca na hetum neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammañca paṭicca hetu neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: … a causally-arisen, causally inoperative, result-yielding state of consciousness arises contingent upon a causally-arisen, causally inoperative, result-yielding state of consciousness and a causally-arisen, causally inoperative, causally inoperative state of consciousness, as root-cause condition. … three.🔽(In brief:)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte🔽nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, purejāte nava, āsevane nava,
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte  nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava purejāte nava āsevane nava
translated: Nine by way of root-cause; nine by way of object; nine by way of predominance; nine by way of proximity; nine by way of contiguity;🔽nine by way of immediacy; nine by way of repetition; nine by way of kamma;

original: kamme nava, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre nava, indriye nava, jhāne nava, magge nava, sampayutte
analyzed: kamme nava vipāke eka āhāre nava indriye nava jhāne nava magge nava sampayutte
translated: nine by way of nutriment; nine by way of faculty; nine by way of jhāna; nine by way of path;

original: nava, vippayutte nava, atthiyā nava, natthiyā nava, vigate nava, avigate nava.
analyzed: nava vippayutte nava atthiyāḥ nava natthiyāḥ nava vigate nava avigate nava
translated: nine by way of association; nine by way of dissociation; nine by way of presence; nine by way of absence; nine by way of disappearance; nine by way of non-disappearance.

original: Nahetvādi
analyzed: na hetu ādi
translated: Non-root-cause, etc.

original: Nahetuṁ nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā.
analyzed: na hetum neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paṭicca na hetu neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā
translated: A causally-arisen, causally inoperative, causally inoperative state of consciousness arises contingent upon a causally-arisen, causally inoperative, causally inoperative state of consciousness, as non-root-cause condition.

original: Hetuṁ nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā.🔽Nahetuṁ nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā.🔽Hetuṁ nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammañca nahetuṁ nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammañca paṭicca nahetu nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā.🔽Hetuṁ nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paṭicca hetu nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā … nava …pe….
analyzed: hetum neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paṭicca na hetu neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā  na hetum neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paṭicca na hetu neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā  hetum neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammañca na hetum neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammañca paṭicca na hetu neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā  hetum neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paṭicca hetu neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ uppajjati na adhipati paccayā nava pe

original: Nahetuṁ nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo uppajjati naāhārapaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare
analyzed: na hetum neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paṭicca na hetu neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo uppajjati na āhāra paccayā  na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava na anantare tīṇi na samanantare
translated: With an object that is neither a root cause nor a result nor having the nature of a result, there is an object that is neither a root cause nor a result nor having the nature of a result. (In brief.)🔽With a root cause as condition, there is one … (in brief).🔽With a condition that is not a condition by way of object, there are three … (in brief).🔽With a condition that is not a condition by way of proximity, there are three … (in brief).

original: tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane🔽nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge
analyzed: tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane  nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne eka na magge
translated: With a condition that is not a condition by way of contiguity, there are three … (in brief).🔽With a condition that is not a condition by way of presence, there are three … (in brief).

original: ekaṁ, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte nava, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ, paccanīyaṁ.)🔽Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ, anulomapaccanīyaṁ.)
analyzed: eka na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte nava no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi saṅkhitta paccanīya  hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi saṅkhitta anuloma paccanīya
translated: With a condition that is not a condition by way of non-disappearance, there are three … (in brief).🔽With a condition that is not a condition by way of root cause, there is an object. (In brief. Reverse order.)🔽With an object that is a root cause, there is an object. (In brief. Forward and reverse order.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ, paccanīyānulomaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇe eka saṅkhitta paccanīya anuloma
translated: With a condition that is not a condition by way of root cause, there is an object. (In brief. Reverse and forward order.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi paccayavāropi nissayavāropi saṁsaṭṭhavāropi sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāraḥ api paccaya vāraḥ api nissaya vāraḥ api sa saṭṭha vāraḥ api sampayutta vāraḥ api paṭicca vāra sadisā vitthāretabbā
translated: (The section on origination should be elaborated in the same way as the section on condition.)

original: Hetvādi
analyzed: hetu ādi
translated: Root-cause condition, etc.

original: Hetu nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo hetussa nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi …pe….🔽Hetu nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo hetussa nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—sahajātādhipati … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ hetussa neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi pe  hetu neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ hetussa neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayo sahajāta ādhipati tīṇi
translated: A root-cause that is neither in result nor a condition for result is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a root-cause that is neither in result nor a condition for result. … There are three kinds. …🔽A root-cause that is neither in result nor a condition for result is a condition, as prenascence condition, for a root-cause that is neither in result nor a condition for result. … There are three kinds. …

original: Nahetu nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo nahetussa nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati … tīṇi …pe….
analyzed: na hetu neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ na hetussa neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati tīṇi pe
translated: A state that is neither a root-cause nor in result nor a condition for result is a condition, as prenascence condition, for a state that is neither a root-cause nor in result nor a condition for result. … There are three kinds. …

original: Purejātādi
analyzed: purejāta ādi
translated: Preceding condition, etc.

original: Nahetu nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo nahetussa nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇapurejātaṁ, vatthupurejātaṁ … tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetu neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ na hetussa neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta vatthu purejātam tīṇi
translated: A state that is neither a root-cause nor in result nor a condition for result is a condition, as preceding condition, for a state that is neither a root-cause nor in result nor a condition for result. … There are three kinds. …

original: Hetu nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo nahetussa nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.🔽Nahetu nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo nahetussa nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: hetu neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ na hetussa neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ  na hetu neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ na hetussa neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A cause that is neither result nor a state of result is a condition, as post-nascence condition, for a cause that is neither result nor a state of result.🔽A cause that is neither result nor a state of result is a condition, as post-nascence condition, for a cause that is neither result nor a state of result.

original: Hetu nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo ca nahetu nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo ca nahetussa nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: hetu neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo ca na hetu neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo ca na hetussa neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A cause that is neither result nor a state of result and a cause that is neither result nor a state of result are conditions, as post-nascence condition, for a cause that is neither result nor a state of result.

original: … Āsevanapaccayena paccayo … nava.
analyzed: āsevana paccayena paccayaḥ nava
translated: … As repetition condition … nine.

original: Nahetu nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo nahetussa nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ na hetussa neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A cause that is neither result nor a state of result is a condition, as kamma condition, for a cause that is neither result nor a state of result. … three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā cha, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte
analyzed: tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā cha anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte
translated: As to cause, there are three; as to object, nine; as to predominance, six; as to proximity, nine; as to contiguity, nine; as to presence, nine; as to absence, nine; as to disappearance, nine; as to non-disappearance, nine; as to arising, nine; as to presence, nine; as to non-disappearance, nine; as to result, nine; as to non-result, nine; as to dissociation, nine; as to nondissociation, nine; as to prior, nine; as to subsequent, nine; as to neither prior nor subsequent, nine; as to support, nine; as to manifestation, nine; as to kamma, nine; as to nutriment, nine; as to faculty, nine; as to path, nine; as to association, nine; as to dissociation, nine; as to presence, nine; as to absence, nine; as to disappearance, nine; as to non-disappearance, nine; as to arising, nine; as to presence, nine; as to non-disappearance, nine; as to result, nine; as to non-result, nine; as to root cause, nine; as to non-root cause, nine; as to non-disappearance, nine; as to arising, nine; as to presence, nine; as to non-disappearance, nine; as to result, nine; as to non-result, nine; as to root cause, nine; as to non-root cause, nine; as to non-disappearance, nine; as to arising, nine; as to presence, nine; as to non-

original: nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi, pacchājāte tīṇi,
analyzed: nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte tīṇi
translated: nine, nine in the other dyads, nine in the dependence dyads, nine in the decisive support dyads, three in the prior dyads, three in the subsequent dyads,

original: āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi, āhāre tīṇi, indriye nava, jhāne tīṇi, magge nava, sampayutte
analyzed: āsevane nava kamme tīṇi āhāre tīṇi indriye nava jhāne tīṇi magge nava sampayutte
translated: nine in the support dyads, three in the action dyads, three in the nutriment dyads, nine in the faculty dyads, three in the path dyads, nine in the association dyads,

original: nava, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā nava, natthiyā nava, vigate nava, avigate nava.
analyzed: nava vippayutte pañca atthiyā nava natthiyā nava vigate nava avigate nava
translated: five in the dissociation dyads, nine in the presence dyads, nine in the absence dyads, nine in the disappearance dyads, nine in the non-disappearance dyads.

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: The reverse order

original: Hetu nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo hetussa nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ hetussa neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo sahajāta paccayena paccayo upanissaya paccayena paccayo saṅkhitta
translated: A state that is neither result nor a resultant phenomenon is a condition, as support condition, for a state that is neither result nor a resultant phenomenon. … It is a condition, as conascence condition, … It is a condition, as decisive support condition, … (In brief.)

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava, naadhipatiyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava na adhipatiyā nava
translated: In the non-cause dyad there are nine. In the non-object dyad there are nine. In the non-predominance dyad there are nine. (In brief.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: In the cause condition there are three in the non-object dyad. (In brief.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the non-cause condition there are nine in the object dyad. (In brief.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: (As in the case of the three wholesome roots, the questions in the section on the root-conditions should be calculated in the direct method, the reverse method, the direct-reverse method, and the reverse-direct method.)

original: Hetudukavipākattikaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.🔽3.1.4. Hetuduka, Upādinnattika
analyzed: hetu duka vipāka ttikam  hetu duka
translated: The section on root-conditions and resultants is finished.🔽… with root-cause, with sustenance

original: 3.1.4.1. Upādinnupādāniyapada🔽3.1.4.1.1–6 Paṭiccādivāra
analyzed: upādin upādāniya pada
translated: … with sustenance and with an object🔽… with conditions, etc.

original: Paccayacatukka🔽1.4.1.7. Pañhāvāra🔽Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka  pañhāvāra  paccaya catukka
translated: Conditions in groups of four🔽… Questions

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Conditions in groups of four🔽Root-cause

original: Hetuṁ upādinnupādāniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu upādinnupādāniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Nahetuṁ upādinnupādāniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu upādinnupādāniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetum upādinnupādāniyam dhammam paṭicca hetu upādinnupādāniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  na hetum upādinnupādāniyam dhammam paṭicca na hetu upādinnupādāniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With root-cause and with sustenance as condition there arises the wholesome with sustenance …🔽With root-cause and without sustenance as condition there arises the wholesome without sustenance …

original: Hetuṁ upādinnupādāniyañca nahetuṁ upādinnupādāniyañca dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu upādinnupādāniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetum upādinnupādāniyam ca na hetum upādinnupādāniyam ca dhammam paṭicca hetu upādinnupādāniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With root-cause and with sustenance and with root-cause and without sustenance as condition there arises the wholesome with sustenance … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava …pe… kamme nava, vipāke nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava anantare nava samanantare nava pe kamme nava vipāke nava pe avigate nava
translated: With nine kinds of non-disappearance.

original: Nahetvādi🔽Nahetuṁ upādinnupādāniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu upādinnupādāniyo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā.
analyzed: na hetu ādi  na hetum upādinnupādāniyam dhammam paṭicca na hetu upādinnupādāniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā
translated: (In brief.)🔽Neither as root-cause, etc.🔽With neither as root-cause, with what is clung to as object, there arises what is not clung to, with neither as root-cause condition.

original: Hetuṁ upādinnupādāniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu upādinnupādāniyo dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā.🔽Nahetuṁ upādinnupādāniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu upādinnupādāniyo dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā.🔽Hetuṁ upādinnupādāniyañca nahetuṁ upādinnupādāniyañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu upādinnupādāniyo dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā.
analyzed: hetum upādinnupādāniyam dhammam paṭicca na hetu upādinnupādāniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā  na hetum upādinnupādāniyam dhammam paṭicca na hetu upādinnupādāniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā  hetum upādinnupādāniyam ca na hetum upādinnupādāniyam ca dhammam paṭicca na hetu upādinnupādāniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā
translated: With a root-cause, with what is clung to as object, there arises what is not clung to, with non-root-cause condition.🔽With neither as root-cause, with what is clung to as object, there arises what is not clung to, with non-root-cause condition.🔽With a root-cause, with what is clung to as object, and with neither as root-cause, with what is clung to as object, there arises what is not clung to, with non-root-cause condition.🔽With a root-cause, with what is clung to as object, there arises what is not clung to, with non-predominance condition. …

original: Hetuṁ upādinnupādāniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu upādinnupādāniyo dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā … nava …pe….
analyzed: hetum upādinnupādāniyam dhammam paṭicca hetu upādinnupādāniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na adhipati paccayā nava pe
translated: With nine kinds of object. …

original: Nahetuṁ upādinnupādāniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu upādinnupādāniyo dhammo uppajjati navipākapaccayā … naāhārapaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare🔽tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane🔽nava, navipāke ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte🔽tīṇi, navippayutte nava, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetum upādinnupādāniyam dhammam paṭicca na hetu upādinnupādāniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na vipāka paccayā na āhāra paccayā saṅkhitta  na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava na anantare tīṇi na samanantare  tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane  nava navipāke eka na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte  tīṇi na vippayutte nava no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: With non-cause as condition, a non-caused, clung-to condition arises. … With non-nutritive-essence as condition, a non-nutritive-essence, clung-to condition arises. (In brief.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Sahajātavāropi paccayavāropi nissayavāropi saṁsaṭṭhavāropi sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)🔽Hetu-ārammaṇa
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi 🔽na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe eka saṅkhitta 🔽sahajāta vāraḥ api paccaya vāraḥ api nissaya vāraḥ api sa saṭṭha vāraḥ api sampayutta vāraḥ api paṭicca vāra sadisā vitthāretabbā 🔽hetu ārammaṇa
translated: With non-cause as condition, one … With non-object as condition, three … With non-predominance as condition, nine … With non-antecedent as condition, three … With non-conascence as condition, three … With non-concomitance as condition, three … With non-dependence as condition, three … With non-deprivation as condition, three … With non-restraint as condition, three … With non-possession as condition, three … With non-non-possession as condition, one … With non-obtainment as condition, one … With non-undertaking as condition, one … With non-prepares-a-state as condition, one … With non-deterioration as condition, one … With non-death as condition, one … With non-rebirth as condition, one … With non-ageing as condition, one … With non-disease as condition, one … With non-passing-away as condition, one … With non-kamma as condition, one … With non-result as condition, one … With non-nutritive-essence as condition, one … With non-consciousness as condition, one … With non-character-non-appearance as condition, one … With non-contact as condition, one … With non-feeling as condition, one … With non-perception as condition, one … With non-volitional-formation as condition, one … With non-consciousness as condition, one … With non-character-non-appearance as condition, one … With non-contact as condition, one … With non-feeling as condition, one … With non-perception as condition, one … With non-volitional-formation as condition, one … With non-consciousness as condition, one … With non-character-non-appearance as condition, one … With non-contact as condition, one … With non-feeling as condition, one … With non-perception as condition, one … With non-volitional-formation as condition, one … With non-consciousness as condition, one … With non-character-non-appearance as condition, one … With non-contact as condition, one … With non-feeling as condition, one … With non-perception as

original: Hetu upādinnupādāniyo dhammo hetussa upādinnupādāniyassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu upādinnupādāniyaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa upādinnupādāniyassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A cause that is clung-to and subject to clinging is related to a cause that is clung-to and subject to clinging as a condition being a cause. … There are three.

original: Hetu upādinnupādāniyo dhammo hetussa upādinnupādāniyassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu upādinnupādāniyaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa upādinnupādāniyassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A cause that is clung-to and subject to clinging is related to a cause that is clung-to and subject to clinging as a condition being a object. … There are three.

original: Nahetu upādinnupādāniyo dhammo nahetussa upādinnupādāniyassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetu upādinnupādāniyaḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa upādinnupādāniyassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A cause that is not clung-to and not subject to clinging is related to a cause that is not clung-to and not subject to clinging as a condition being a object. … There are three.

original: Hetu upādinnupādāniyo ca nahetu upādinnupādāniyo ca dhammā hetussa upādinnupādāniyassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu upādinnupādāniyo ca na hetu upādinnupādāniyo ca dhammā hetussa upādinnupādāniyassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi saṅkhitta
translated: A cause that is clung-to and subject to clinging and a cause that is not clung-to and not subject to clinging are related to a cause that is clung-to and subject to clinging as a condition being a object. … There are three. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte nava, aññamaññe
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe nava anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte nava aññamaññe
translated: There are three in the case of cause. There are nine in the case of object. There are nine in the case of proximity. There are nine in the case of contiguity. There are nine in the case of immediacy. There are nine in the case of repetition.

original: nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi, pacchājāte tīṇi, kamme tīṇi,
analyzed: nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte tīṇi kamme tīṇi
translated: There are nine in the case of dependence. There are nine in the case of decisive support. There are three in the case of prenascence. There are three in the case of postnascence. There are three in the case of kamma.

original: vipāke nava, āhāre tīṇi, indriye nava, jhāne tīṇi, magge nava, sampayutte nava, vippayutte

translated: Nine in result. Three in nutriment. Nine in faculties. Three in jhāna. Nine in path. Nine in association.🔽Nine in dissociation.

translated: Five in presence. Nine in absence. Nine in disappearance. Nine in non-disappearance.

translated: Cause🔽A condition that is without thought and with only investigation is related to a cause that is without thought and with only investigation as a condition being a cause. … There are three.

original: Nahetuṁ avitakkavicāramattaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu avitakkavicāramatto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetum avitakka vicāra mattam dhammam paṭicca na hetu avitakka vicāra mattaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: A condition that is without a cause and without thought and with only investigation is related to a cause that is without a cause and without thought and with only investigation as a condition being a cause. … There are three.

original: Hetuṁ avitakkavicāramattañca nahetuṁ avitakkavicāramattañca dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu avitakkavicāramatto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetum avitakka vicāra mattam ca na hetum avitakka vicāra mattam ca dhammam paṭicca hetu avitakka vicāra mattaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: A condition that is without a cause and without thought and with only investigation is related to a cause that is without a cause and without thought and with only investigation as a condition being a cause. … There are three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… kamme nava, vipāke nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe kamme nava vipāke nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on the nine kinds of conditions, there are nine in the cause condition. There are nine in the object condition. There are nine in the predominance condition. … There are nine in the kamma condition. There are nine in the result condition. … There are nine in the unities. (Abbreviated.)

original: Naadhipati
analyzed: na adhipati
translated: Non-predominance

original: Hetuṁ avitakkavicāramattaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu avitakkavicāramatto dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetum a vitakka vicāra mattam dhammam paṭicca hetu a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na adhipati paccayā
translated: A condition that is without thought and with only investigation is related to a cause that is without thought and with only investigation as a condition not being a predominance. … (Abbreviated.)

original: Naadhipatiyā nava, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, navippayutte nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na adhipatiyā nava na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na vippayutte nava saṅkhitta
translated: With respect to non-dominants, there are nine. With respect to prenascent, there are nine. With respect to postnascent, there are nine. With respect to nutriment, there are nine. With respect to action, there are three. With respect to kamma-result, there are nine. With respect to the dissociated, there are nine. (In brief.)

original: Hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā nava
translated: With respect to conditions that are not dominants, there are nine. (In brief.)

original: Naadhipatipaccayā hetuyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na adhipati paccayāḥ hetuyā nava
translated: With respect to conditions that are not dominants, there are nine. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi paccayavāropi nissayavāropi saṁsaṭṭhavāropi sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāraḥ api paccaya vāraḥ api nissaya vāraḥ api sa saṭṭha vāraḥ api sampayutta vāraḥ api paṭicca vāra sadisā vitthāretabbā
translated: (The method of treatment in the case of the section on conascence, etc., is the same as that in the case of the section on condition.)

original: Hetvādi🔽Hetu avitakkavicāramatto dhammo hetussa avitakkavicāramattassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Hetu avitakkavicāramatto dhammo nahetussa avitakkavicāramattassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu ādi  hetu avitakka vicāra mattaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa avitakka vicāra mattassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  hetu avitakka vicāra mattaḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa avitakka vicāra mattassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: With respect to cause, etc.🔽A state that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought and is a cause is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a state that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought. … There are three triplets.🔽A state that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought and is a cause is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is not a cause and is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought. … There are three triplets.

original: Hetu avitakkavicāramatto dhammo hetussa avitakkavicāramattassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—sahajātādhipati … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu avitakka vicāra mattaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa avitakka vicāra mattassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayo sahajāta ādhipati tīṇi
translated: A state that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought and is a cause is a condition, as dominant condition, for a state that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought and is a cause, being a conascence, prenascence, and postnascence condition. … There are three triplets.

original: Nahetu avitakkavicāramatto dhammo nahetussa avitakkavicāramattassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati … tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetu avitakka vicāra mattaḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa avitakka vicāra mattassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati tīṇi
translated: A state without root-cause that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, as dominant condition, for a state without root-cause that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought. Herein, as object-predominance, as co-nascence, as mutuality, as kamma-result, there are three.

original: Hetu avitakkavicāramatto ca nahetu avitakkavicāramatto ca dhammā nahetussa avitakkavicāramattassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu avitakka vicāra matto ca na hetu avitakka vicāra matto ca dhammā na hetussa avitakka vicāra mattassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati
translated: A state with root-cause that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought and a state without root-cause that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought are conditions, as dominant condition, for a state without root-cause that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought. Herein, as object-predominance … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā satta, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā satta anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte
translated: In the root-cause section there are three, in the object section there are three, in the predominance section there are seven, in the proximity section there are nine, in the contiguity section there are nine, in the conascence section there are

analyzed: nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava āsevane nava kamme tīṇi vipāke
translated: nine, in the mutuality section there are nine, in the dependence section there are nine, in the support section there are nine, in the prenascence section there are nine, in the postnascence section there are nine, in the repetition section there are nine, in the kamma section there are three, in the result section there are

original: nava, āhāre tīṇi, indriye nava, jhāne tīṇi, magge nava, sampayutte nava, atthiyā
analyzed: nava āhāre tīṇi indriye nava jhāne tīṇi magge nava sampayutte nava atthiyā
translated: nine, in the nutriment section there are three, in the faculty section there are nine, in the jhāna section there are three, in the path section there are nine, in the association section there are nine, in the presence section there are

original: nava, natthiyā nava, vigate nava, avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: nava natthiyā nava vigate nava avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: nine, in the absence section there are nine, in the disappearance section there are nine, in the non-disappearance section there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: The reverse order method

original: Hetu avitakkavicāramatto dhammo hetussa avitakkavicāramattassa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. Avitakkaavicārapada🔽3.1.6.3.1–6 Paṭiccādivāra🔽Paccayacatukka
analyzed: hetu avitakka vicāra mattaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa avitakka vicāra mattassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta  na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta  hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi  na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi  yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba  a vitakka a vicāra pada       paccaya catukka
translated: A cause that is accompanied by thinking and exploring is a condition, as conascence condition, for a state that is accompanied by thinking and exploring … (Abbreviated.)
