analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe kamme nava vipāke nava pe vigate nava avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: With nine lines beginning “With nine as non-disappearance …”.

analyzed: na hetu ādi  na hetum avitakka avicāram dhammam paṭicca na hetu avitakka avicāraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā
translated: (Abbreviated.)🔽Neither as root cause, etc.🔽With nine lines beginning “With a neither-as-root-cause-nor-as-object condition …”,🔽With nine lines beginning “With a neither-as-root-cause-nor-as-object condition …”,

analyzed: hetum avitakka avicāram dhammam paṭicca hetu avitakka avicāraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na adhipati paccayā nava
translated: With nine lines beginning “With a neither-as-root-cause-nor-as-object condition …”,

original: Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare🔽tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane🔽nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge
analyzed: na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava na anantare tīṇi na samanantare  tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane  nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne eka na magge
translated: With respect to non-cause, there is one. With respect to non-object, there are three. With respect to non-predominance, there are nine. With respect to non-antecedent, there are three. With respect to non-conascence, there are three. With respect to non-concomitance, there are three. With respect to non-dependence, there are three. With respect to non-decisive support, there are three. With respect to non-root, there are three. With respect to non-conascence, there are nine. With respect to non-kamma, there are three. With respect to non-result, there are nine. With respect to non-nutriment, there is one. With respect to non-faculty, there is one. With respect to non-path, there is one.

original: ekaṁ, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte nava, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: eka na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte nava no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: With non-cause as condition, there is one … With non-object as condition, there are three … With non-predominance as condition, there are nine … With non-antecedent as condition, there are three … With non-consequent as condition, there are three … With non-conascence as condition, there are three … With non-deprivation as condition, there are three … With non-disappearance as condition, there are three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: With cause as condition, with non-object as condition, there are three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe eka saṅkhitta
translated: With non-cause as condition, with object as condition, there is one. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi paccayavāropi nissayavāropi saṁsaṭṭhavāropi sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāraḥ api paccaya vāraḥ api nissaya vāraḥ api sa saṭṭha vāraḥ api sampayutta vāraḥ api paṭicca vāra sadisā vitthāretabbā
translated: (The section on origination should be elaborated in the same way as the section on condition.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa
translated: With cause and object

original: Hetu avitakkaavicāro dhammo hetussa avitakkaavicārassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu avitakka avicāraḥ dhammaḥ hetussa avitakka avicārassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A cause that is without thought and without examination is related to a cause that is without thought and without examination as a condition by way of being a cause. … There are three.

original: Hetu avitakkaavicāro dhammo hetussa avitakkaavicārassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu avitakka avicāraḥ dhammaḥ hetussa avitakka avicārassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ nava
translated: A cause that is without thought and without investigation is related to a cause that is without thought and without investigation as object condition … nine. (Abbreviated.)

analyzed: tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā cha anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte

analyzed: nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte tīṇi

analyzed: āsevane nava kamme tīṇi vipāke nava āhāre tīṇi indriye nava jhāne tīṇi magge
translated: in repetition there are nine, in kamma there are three, in result there are nine, in nutriment there are three, in faculty there are nine, in jhāna there are three, in path there are

analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava na adhipatiyā nava
translated: With no cause nine. With no object nine. With no predominance nine. (In brief.)

translated: With no cause as condition, with object nine. (In brief.)

original: Nahetuṁ pītisahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu pītisahagato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetum pīti sahagatam dhammam paṭicca na hetu pīti sahagataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a cause that is not accompanied by joy, there arises with a cause that is not accompanied by joy, by way of condition being a cause. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… kamme nava, vipāke nava, āhāre nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetu-naadhipati🔽Nahetuṁ pītisahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu pītisahagato dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā.🔽Hetuṁ pītisahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu pītisahagato dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe kamme nava vipāke nava āhāre nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta  na hetunā adhipati  na hetum pīti sahagatam dhammam paṭicca na hetu pīti sahagataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā  hetum pīti sahagatam dhammam paṭicca hetu pīti sahagataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na adhipati paccayā
translated: With nine as root, nine as object, nine as condition being, nine as nutriment, nine as faculty, nine as path, nine as association, nine as dissociation, nine as presence, nine as absence, nine as disappearance, nine as non-disappearance, nine as fruit, and nine as neither as root nor as non-root. (Abbreviated.)🔽Neither as root nor as condition being🔽With a condition that is not a root, there is an effect that is not a root.🔽With a root that is a condition, there is an effect that is not a root. (Abbreviated.)🔽🔽

original: Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā nava, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Sahajātavāropi paccayavāropi nissayavāropi saṁsaṭṭhavāropi sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)🔽Hetvādi

original: Hetu pītisahagato dhammo hetussa pītisahagatassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu pīti sahagataḥ dhammaḥ hetussa pīti sahagatassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A cause that is accompanied by rapture is related to a cause that is accompanied by rapture as a cause condition … (three instances).

original: Hetu pītisahagato dhammo hetussa pītisahagatassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Nahetu pītisahagato dhammo nahetussa pītisahagatassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Hetu pītisahagato ca nahetu pītisahagato ca dhammā hetussa pītisahagatassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Hetu pītisahagato dhammo hetussa pītisahagatassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu pīti sahagataḥ dhammaḥ hetussa pīti sahagatassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  na hetu pīti sahagataḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa pīti sahagatassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  hetu pīti sahagataḥ ca na hetu pīti sahagataḥ ca dhammā hetussa pīti sahagatassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  hetu pīti sahagataḥ dhammaḥ hetussa pīti sahagatassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati tīṇi
translated: A cause that is accompanied by rapture is related to a cause that is accompanied by rapture as a object condition … (three instances).🔽A cause that is not accompanied by rapture is related to a cause that is not accompanied by rapture as a object condition … (three instances).🔽A cause that is accompanied by rapture and a cause that is not accompanied by rapture are related to a cause that is accompanied by rapture as a object condition … (three instances).🔽A cause that is accompanied by rapture is related to a cause that is accompanied by rapture as a dominant condition—as object-predominance and as co-nascence … (three instances).

original: Nahetu pītisahagato dhammo nahetussa pītisahagatassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati … tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetu pīti sahagataḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa pīti sahagatassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati tīṇi
translated: A cause that is not accompanied by rapture is related to a cause that is not accompanied by rapture as a dominant condition—as object-predominance and as co-nascence … (three instances).

original: Hetu pītisahagato ca nahetu pītisahagato ca dhammā hetussa pītisahagatassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte🔽nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi, vipāke🔽nava, āhāre tīṇi, indriye nava, jhāne tīṇi, magge nava, sampayutte nava, atthiyā
analyzed: hetu pīti sahagato ca na hetu pīti sahagato ca dhammā hetussa pīti sahagatassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayo ārammaṇa ādhipati tīṇi  tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte  nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava āsevane nava kamme tīṇi vipāke  nava āhāre tīṇi indriye nava jhāne tīṇi magge nava sampayutte nava atthiyā
translated: Factors that are causes and are accompanied by joy are related to a cause that is accompanied by joy as a dominant condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽(The following are to be elaborated in the same way as in §11.)

original: nava, natthiyā nava, vigate nava, avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: nava natthiyā nava vigate nava avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on cause, there are three triplets and three duals; in the section on object, there are nine duals; in the section on predominance, there are nine duals; in the section on proximity, there are nine duals; in the section on contiguity, there are nine duals; in the section on conascence, there are nine duals; in the section on mutuality, there are nine duals; in the section on support, there are nine duals; in the section on dependence, there are nine duals; in the section on association, there are nine duals; in the section on dissociation, there are nine duals; in the section on presence, there are nine duals; in the section on absence, there are nine duals; in the section on disappearance, there are nine duals; in the section on non-disappearance, there are nine duals. (Abbreviated.)

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: Reversing the order

original: Hetu pītisahagato dhammo hetussa pītisahagatassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu pīti sahagataḥ dhammaḥ hetussa pīti sahagatassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: A factor that is a cause and is accompanied by joy is related to a cause that is accompanied by joy as a condition by way of object condition … as a condition by way of conascence condition … as a condition by way of decisive support condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the absence of cause, there are nine duals; in the absence of object, there are nine duals. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: With root-cause as condition, non-object, three. (In brief.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: With non-root-cause as condition, object, nine. (In brief.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: (As in the case of the three wholesome kinds of consciousness, the method of exposition should be understood as applied in the case of the fourfold method, the fivefold method, etc., in the exposition of the questions serially and reversely, and in the exposition of the serial and reverse order.)

analyzed: hetu sukha sahagataḥ dhammaḥ hetussa sukha sahagatassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ nava
translated: A cause that is associated with pleasure is related to a cause that is associated with pleasure as a predominance condition … nine. (In brief)

analyzed: tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte
translated: In the case of cause, there are three; in the case of object, nine; in the case of predominance, nine; in the case of proximity, nine; in the case of contiguity, nine; in the case of conascence,

analyzed: nava āhāre tīṇi indriye nava jhāne tīṇi magge nava sampayutte nava atthiyā
translated: nine; in the case of the faculties, nine; in the case of absorption, three; in the case of the path, nine; in the case of association, nine; in the case of presence,

analyzed: nava natthiyā nava vigate nava avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: nine; in the case of absence, nine; in the case of disappearance, nine; in the case of non-disappearance, nine. (In brief)

analyzed: hetum upekkhā sahagatam dhammam paṭicca hetu upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With regard to the clause “a cause that is associated with equanimity,” there are three triplets and three dyads.

original: Nahetuṁ upekkhāsahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu upekkhāsahagato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Hetuṁ upekkhāsahagatañca nahetuṁ upekkhāsahagatañca dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu upekkhāsahagato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetum upekkhā sahagatam dhammam paṭicca na hetu upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  hetum upekkhā sahagatam ca na hetum upekkhā sahagatam ca dhammam paṭicca hetu upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With non-cause as condition, a non-cause associated with equanimity … (three times, as above.)🔽With a cause associated with equanimity and with a non-cause associated with equanimity as conditions, a cause associated with equanimity … (three times, as above, but in brief.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… kamme nava, vipāke nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe kamme nava vipāke nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on root cause, there are nine; in the section on object, there are nine; in the section on predominance, there are nine. … In the section on kamma, there are nine; in the section on result, there are nine. … In the section on non-hindrance, there are nine. (In brief.)

original: Nahetvādi🔽Nahetuṁ upekkhāsahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu upekkhāsahagato dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā … dve.🔽Hetuṁ upekkhāsahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu upekkhāsahagato dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā … nava.
analyzed: na hetu ādi  na hetum upekkhā sahagatam dhammam paṭicca na hetu upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammo uppajjati na hetu paccayā dve  hetum upekkhā sahagatam dhammam paṭicca hetu upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na adhipati paccayā nava
translated: With non-cause as condition, etc.🔽With a non-cause associated with equanimity as condition, a non-cause associated with equanimity … (two times, as above.)🔽With a cause associated with equanimity as condition, a cause associated with equanimity … (nine times, as above.)

original: Hetuṁ upekkhāsahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu upekkhāsahagato dhammo uppajjati napurejātapaccayā … nava.
analyzed: hetum upekkhā sahagatam dhammam paṭicca hetu upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na purejāta paccayā nava
translated: With a cause associated with equanimity as condition, a cause associated with equanimity … (nine times, as above.)

original: Hetuṁ upekkhāsahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu upekkhāsahagato dhammo uppajjati napacchājātapaccayā … nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetum upekkhā sahagatam dhammam paṭicca hetu upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na pacchājāta paccayā nava
translated: With respect to cause that is associated with equanimity, there are nine results that are associated with equanimity. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā dve, naadhipatiyā nava, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā dve na adhipatiyā nava na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na jhāne eka na magge eka na vippayutte nava saṅkhitta
translated: With respect to non-cause, there are two results. With respect to non-dominance, there are nine results. With respect to non-pre-arising, there are nine results. With respect to non-post-arising, there are nine results. With respect to non-decisive support, there are nine results. With respect to non-kamma, there are three results. With respect to non-kamma-result, there are nine results. With respect to non-absorption, there is one result. With respect to non-path, there is one result. With respect to non-non-causality, there are nine results. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā nava
translated: With respect to cause as condition, there are nine results. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe dve
translated: With respect to non-cause as condition, there are two results. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi paccayavāropi nissayavāropi saṁsaṭṭhavāropi sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāraḥ api paccaya vāraḥ api nissaya vāraḥ api sa saṭṭha vāraḥ api sampayutta vāraḥ api paṭicca vāra sadisā vitthāretabbā
translated: (The section on origination should be expanded as for the dependent origination, condition, support, combination, and association.)

original: Hetvādi
analyzed: hetu ādi
translated: Cause, etc.

original: Hetu upekkhāsahagato dhammo hetussa upekkhāsahagatassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammaḥ hetussa upekkhā sahagatassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A cause that is associated with equanimity is related to a result that is associated with equanimity as cause condition. … there are three results.

original: Hetu upekkhāsahagato dhammo hetussa upekkhāsahagatassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … nava.
analyzed: hetu upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammaḥ hetussa upekkhā sahagatassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ nava
translated: A cause that is associated with equanimity is related to a result that is associated with equanimity as object condition. … there are nine results.

original: Hetu upekkhāsahagato dhammo hetussa upekkhāsahagatassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte
analyzed: hetu upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammaḥ hetussa upekkhā sahagatassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ nava  tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte
translated: A cause that is associated with equanimity … is related to a cause that is associated with equanimity as a dominant condition … nine. (In brief:)

original: nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi, vipāke🔽nava, āhāre tīṇi, indriye nava, jhāne tīṇi, magge nava, sampayutte nava, atthiyā
analyzed: nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava āsevane nava kamme tīṇi vipāke  nava āhāre tīṇi indriye nava jhāne tīṇi magge nava sampayutte nava atthiyā
translated: In the section on cause there are three triplets and one couplet. In the section on object there are nine. In the section on predominance there are nine. In the section on proximity there are nine. In the section on contiguity there are nine. In the section on simoultaneity there are

original: nava, natthiyā nava, vigate nava, avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: nava natthiyā nava vigate nava avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: nine. In the section on presence there are nine. In the section on absence there are nine. In the section on disappearance there are nine. In the section on non-disappearance there are nine. (In brief:)

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: The reverse order

original: Hetu upekkhāsahagato dhammo hetussa upekkhāsahagatassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammaḥ hetussa upekkhā sahagatassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: A cause that is associated with equanimity is related to a cause that is associated with equanimity as a object condition, as a kamma condition, as a nutriment condition, as a faculty condition, as a jhāna condition, as a path condition, as a association condition, as a presence condition, as a absence condition, as a disappearance condition, and as a non-disappearance condition. (In brief:)

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the absence of cause there are nine. In the absence of object there are nine. (In brief:)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: In the presence of cause and in the absence of object there are three. (In brief:)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: With no condition of root cause, nine in object. (In brief) …

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: (As in the case of the three wholesome kinds of consciousness, the method of exposition should be understood here in the same way as in the triad of questions in the connected pairs, the triad of questions in the connected triplets, and the triad of questions in the connected quadruples.)

original: Hetudukapītittikaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.🔽3.1.8. Hetuduka, Dassanenapahātabbattika🔽3.1.8.1. Dassanenapahātabbapada
analyzed: hetu duka pītittikam  hetu duka dassanena apahātabba ttika  dassanena apahātabba pada
translated: The section on the root-cause triad is finished.🔽… with root-cause, the triad of what is to be abandoned by vision🔽… the section on what is to be abandoned by vision

original: 3.1.8.1.1–6 Paṭiccādivāra
translated: … the section on the first type

original: Paccayacatukka🔽1.8.1.7. Pañhāvāra
analyzed: paccaya catukka  pañhāvāra
translated: The four kinds of condition🔽… the section on questions

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The four kinds of condition

original: Hetu🔽Hetuṁ dassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu dassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Nahetuṁ dassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu dassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu  hetum dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca hetu dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  na hetum dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na hetu dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: Root-cause🔽With root-cause, with what is to be abandoned by vision as condition, there arises what is to be abandoned by vision with root-cause, by root-cause condition … three.🔽With no root-cause, with what is to be abandoned by vision as condition, there arises what is to be abandoned by vision with no root-cause, by root-cause condition … three.

original: Hetuṁ dassanena pahātabbañca nahetuṁ dassanena pahātabbañca dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu dassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetum dassanena pahātabbañca na hetum dassanena pahātabbañca dhammam paṭicca hetu dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With root-cause, with what is to be abandoned by vision and with no root-cause as condition, there arises what is to be abandoned by vision with root-cause, by root-cause condition … three. (In brief) …

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… kamme nava, āhāre nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe kamme nava āhāre nava pe avigate nava
translated: With nine in terms of cause, nine in terms of object, nine in terms of predominance … nine in terms of kamma, nine in terms of nutriment … nine in terms of dissociation. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetu-naadhipati
analyzed: na hetunā adhipati
translated: Neither as condition nor as predominance

original: Nahetuṁ dassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu dassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā.
analyzed: na hetum dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca hetu dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā
translated: With a state that is to be given up through vision as condition, a state that is to be given up through vision arises that is without cause, by way of conditionality.

original: Hetuṁ dassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu dassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā … nava.
analyzed: hetum dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca hetu dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na adhipati paccayā nava
translated: With a state that is to be given up through vision as condition, a state that is to be given up through vision arises that is without cause, by way of non-predominance. … nine.

original: Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā nava, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, navippayutte nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyāḥ eka na adhipatiyāḥ nava na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na vippayutte nava saṅkhitta
translated: With neither as cause nor as predominance … one. With neither as prior … one. With neither as proximate … one. With neither as distant … one. With neither as arisen … one. With neither as unarisen … one. With neither as arisen or unarisen … one. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā nava
translated: With cause as condition, with non-predominance … nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe eka saṅkhitta
translated: With neither as condition, with object … one. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi paccayavāropi nissayavāropi saṁsaṭṭhavāropi sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāraḥ api paccaya vāraḥ api nissaya vāraḥ api sa saṭṭha vāraḥ api sampayutta vāraḥ api paṭicca vāra sadisā vitthāretabbā
translated: (The section on “with origination” should be elaborated in the same way as the section on “with condition” and the rest.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa
translated: With cause and object

original: Hetu dassanena pahātabbo dhammo hetussa dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Hetu dassanena pahātabbo dhammo hetussa dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte🔽nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi, āhāre
analyzed: hetu dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  hetu dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ nava saṅkhitta  tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte  nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava āsevane nava kamme tīṇi āhāre
translated: A state that is to be given up by seeing is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a state that is to be given up by seeing … for three.🔽A state that is to be given up by seeing is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is to be given up by seeing … for nine. (Abbreviated.)🔽In the case of root-cause, there are three; in the case of object, there are nine; in the case of predominance, there are nine; in the case of proximity, there are nine; in the case of contiguity, there are nine; in the case of immediacy, there are nine; in the case of repetition, there are nine; in the case of kamma, there are three; in the case of nutriment, there are three; in the case of faculty, there are three; in the case of jhāna, there are three; in the case of path, there are three; in the case of association, there are nine; in the case of dissociation, there are nine; in the case of presence, there are nine; in the case of absence, there are nine; in the case of disappearance, there are nine; in the case of non-disappearance, there are nine; in the case of arising, there are nine; in the case of presence of result, there are nine; in the case of past, there are nine; in the case of future, there are nine; in the case of present, there are nine; in the case of unarisen, there are nine; in the case of arisen, there are nine; in the case of non-arisen and arisen, there are nine.

original: tīṇi, indriye tīṇi, jhāne tīṇi, magge tīṇi, sampayutte nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Paccanīyuddhāra🔽Hetu dassanena pahātabbo dhammo hetussa dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: With non-cause as condition … (abbreviated).

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: With cause as condition, not object … (abbreviated).

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: With non-cause as condition, object … (abbreviated).

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: (As in the section on the wholesome triad, the permutation series is calculated in terms of the following four permutations: direct application, reverse application, direct and reverse application, and reverse and direct application.)

original: 3.1.8.2. Bhāvanāyapahātabbapada🔽3.1.8.2.1–6 Paṭiccādivāra
analyzed: bhāvanā aya pahātabba pada
translated: … to be given up through development🔽… with respect to condition …

original: Paccayacatukka🔽1.8.2.7. Pañhāvāra
analyzed: paccaya catukka  pañhāvāra
translated: The four condition tetrads🔽… the question series

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The four condition tetrads

original: Hetu🔽Hetuṁ bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu  hetum bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca hetu bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: Cause🔽With a causally arisen factor to be given up through development as condition, a causally arisen factor to be given up through development arises, by way of condition being cause … there are three.

original: Nahetuṁ bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetum bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na hetu bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With a non-causally arisen factor to be given up through development as condition, a non-causally arisen factor to be given up through development arises, by way of condition being cause … there are three.

original: Hetuṁ bhāvanāya pahātabbañca nahetuṁ bhāvanāya pahātabbañca dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetum bhāvanāya pahātabbañca na hetum bhāvanāya pahātabbañca dhammam paṭicca hetu bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: Conditioned by a cause that is to be abandoned by development and a cause that is not to be abandoned by development, there is a cause that is to be abandoned by development. … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: (Nine sets of nine.)

original: Nahetu
analyzed: na hetu
translated: Not a cause

original: Nahetuṁ bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetum bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca hetu bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā
translated: Conditioned by a state that is not a cause and that is to be abandoned by development, there is a state that is a cause and that is to be abandoned by development. … (Abbreviated.)🔽(Nine sets of nine.)🔽(The section on “not a condition” should be elaborated in the same way as for the section on “not a cause,” but omitting the first two sets of nine.)🔽Conditioned by a cause that is not a condition, there is a state that is not a cause. … (Abbreviated.)🔽(The section on “not a condition” should be elaborated in the same way as for the section on “not a cause,” but omitting the first two sets of nine.)

original: Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā nava, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, navippayutte nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyāḥ eka na adhipatiyāḥ nava na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na vippayutte nava saṅkhitta  hetu paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā nava
translated: Conditioned by a state that is not a cause and that is not a condition, there is a state that is not a cause. … (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe eka saṅkhitta
translated: (The section on “not a condition” should be elaborated in the same way as for the section on “not a cause,” but omitting the first two sets of nine.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi paccayavāropi nissayavāropi saṁsaṭṭhavāropi sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāraḥ api paccaya vāraḥ api nissaya vāraḥ api sa saṭṭha vāraḥ api sampayutta vāraḥ api paṭicca vāra sadisā vitthāretabbā
translated: (The method of elaboration for the sections on “conascence,” etc., is the same as that for the “conditions” section.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa
translated: Cause and object

original: Hetu bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo hetussa bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A factor that is to be given up through development and is a cause is a condition, as cause condition, for a factor that is to be given up through development. … (Three triplets.)

original: Hetu bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo hetussa bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte
analyzed: hetu bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ nava saṅkhitta  tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte
translated: A factor that is to be given up through development and is a cause is a condition, as object condition, for a factor that is to be given up through development. … (Nine, abbreviated.)🔽As cause: three. As object: nine. As dominance: nine. As proximity: nine. As contiguity: nine. As immediacy: nine.🔽As repetition: nine. As support: nine. As dissociation: nine. As presence: nine. As absence: nine. As disappearance: nine. As non-disappearance: nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi, āhāre
analyzed: nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava āsevane nava kamme tīṇi āhāre
translated: As root cause: three. As kamma: three. As nutriment: three.

original: tīṇi, indriye tīṇi, jhāne tīṇi, magge tīṇi, sampayutte nava, atthiyā nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: tīṇi indriye tīṇi jhāne tīṇi magge tīṇi sampayutte nava atthiyā nava pe avigate nava
translated: As faculty: three. As jhāna: three. As path: three. As association: nine. As presence: nine. As absence: nine. As disappearance: nine. As non-disappearance: nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: Reversing the order

original: Hetu bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo hetussa bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: A factor that is to be given up through development and is a cause is a condition, as object condition, … as decisive-support condition, … as proximity condition, … as contiguity condition, … as repetition condition, … as support condition, … as dissociation condition, … as presence condition, … as absence condition, … as disappearance condition, … as non-disappearance condition, for a factor that is to be given up through development. … (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: With non-cause as condition, there are nine. (In brief.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: With cause as condition, with non-object as condition, there are three. (In brief.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta  yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: With non-cause as condition, with object as condition, there are nine. (In brief.)🔽(Just as in the case of the three wholesome kinds of kamma, the method of calculation should be understood here in the same way, in forward order, in reverse order, and in both forward and reverse order.)🔽… that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?🔽… that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?

original: 3.1.8.3. Nevadassanenanabhāvanāyapahātabbapada🔽3.1.8.3.1–6 Paṭiccādivāra
analyzed: na iva dassana nana bhāvanā ya pahātabba pada
translated: … that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?🔽… that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: … that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?🔽… that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?🔽… that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?🔽… that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?🔽… that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?

original: 1.8.3.7. Pañhāvāra
analyzed: pañhāvāra
translated: … that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?🔽… that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?

original: Paccayacatukka🔽Hetu
analyzed: paccaya catukka  hetu
translated: … that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?🔽… that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?🔽… that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?🔽… that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?🔽… that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?🔽… that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?

original: Hetuṁ nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetum na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca hetu na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: … that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?🔽… that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?🔽… that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?🔽… that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?🔽… that are not to be given up by seeing or by development, as object?

original: Nahetuṁ nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetum na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: … that are not to be given up by seeing or by development

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… kamme nava, vipāke nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe kamme nava vipāke nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: … as object nine times …

original: Nahetvādi🔽Nahetuṁ nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā.
analyzed: na hetu ādi  na hetum na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā
translated: As non-cause, etc.🔽With ignorance as condition, a non-cause that is neither to be abandoned by seeing nor by cultivation arises.

original: Hetuṁ nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā.
analyzed: hetum na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā
translated: With a cause that is to be abandoned by seeing and by cultivation as condition, a non-cause that is neither to be abandoned by seeing nor by cultivation arises.

original: Nahetuṁ nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā.
analyzed: na hetum na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā
translated: With ignorance as condition, a non-cause that is neither to be abandoned by seeing nor by cultivation arises.

original: Hetuṁ nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbañca nahetuṁ nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbañca
analyzed: hetum na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbam ca na hetum na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbam ca
translated: With a cause that is to be abandoned by seeing and by cultivation and a non-cause that is neither to be abandoned by seeing nor by cultivation as condition …

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā.
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca na hetu na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā
translated: A state that is not a cause and that is not to be given up by seeing and by cultivation arises in dependence on a state that is not a cause and that is not to be given up by seeing and by cultivation. The condition being that of object condition …

original: Hetuṁ nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare🔽tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane🔽nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge
analyzed: hetum na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca hetu na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na adhipati paccayā  na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava na anantare tīṇi na samanantare  tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane  nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne eka na magge
translated: A state that is a cause and that is not to be given up by seeing and by cultivation arises in dependence on a state that is not a cause and that is not to be given up by seeing and by cultivation. The condition being that of predominance condition …🔽(In brief, as in the case of the condition being that of object condition.)

original: ekaṁ, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte nava, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: eka na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte nava no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: With respect to the condition being that of non-cause condition, there is one tetrad. With respect to the condition being that of non-object condition, there are three tetrads. With respect to the condition being that of non-predominance condition, there are nine tetrads. With respect to the condition being that of non-antecedent condition, there are three tetrads. With respect to the condition being that of non-conascence condition, there are three tetrads. With respect to the condition being that of non-neighbouring condition, there are three tetrads. With respect to the condition being that of non-decisive support condition, there are three tetrads. With respect to the condition being that of non-foundation condition, there are three tetrads. With respect to the condition being that of non-preceding condition, there are nine tetrads. With respect to the condition being that of non-conascence condition, there are nine tetrads. With respect to the condition being that of non-producing condition, there are nine tetrads. With respect to the condition being that of non-nutritive essence condition, there is one tetrad. With respect to the condition being that of non-faculty condition, there is one tetrad. With respect to the condition being that of non-path condition, there is one tetrad. With respect to the condition being that of non-associatedness condition, there are three tetrads. With respect to the condition being that of non-disappearance condition, there are nine tetrads. With respect to the condition being that of non-restraint condition, there are three tetrads. (In brief, as in the case of the condition being that of object condition.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi 🔽na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe eka saṅkhitta
translated: With respect to the condition being that of cause condition, there are three tetrads. (In brief, as in the case of the condition being that

original: (Sahajātavāropi paccayavāropi nissayavāropi saṁsaṭṭhavāropi sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāraḥ api paccaya vāraḥ api nissaya vāraḥ api sa saṭṭha vāraḥ api sampayutta vāraḥ api paṭicca vāra sadisā vitthāretabbā
translated: (The section on origination should be elaborated in the same way as the section on condition.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa
translated: Cause-object

original: Hetu nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo hetussa nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A cause that is not to be given up by seeing or by keeping in mind is a condition, as condition being a cause, for a cause that is not to be given up by seeing or by keeping in mind. … There are three.

original: Hetu nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo hetussa nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ nava saṅkhitta
translated: A cause that is not to be given up by seeing or by keeping in mind is a condition, as object condition, for a cause that is not to be given up by seeing or by keeping in mind. … (In detail as in the case of seeing and keeping in mind.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte
analyzed: tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte
translated: In the section on cause there are three. In the section on object there are nine. In the section on predominance there are nine. In the section on proximity there are nine. In the section on contiguity there are nine. In the section on conascence there are nine.

original: nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi, pacchājāte tīṇi,
analyzed: nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte tīṇi
translated: In the section on mutuality there are nine. In the section on support there are nine. In the section on dependence there are nine. In the section on prenascence there are three. In the section on postnascence there are three.

original: āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi, vipāke nava, āhāre tīṇi, indriye nava, jhāne tīṇi, magge
analyzed: āsevane nava kamme tīṇi vipāke nava āhāre tīṇi indriye nava jhāne tīṇi magge
translated: In the section on repetition there are nine. In the section on kamma there are three. In the section on result there are nine. In the section on nutriment there are three. In the section on faculty there are nine. In the section on jhāna there are three. In the section on path there are three.

original: nava, sampayutte nava, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā nava, natthiyā nava, vigate nava, avigate nava.
analyzed: nava sampayutte nava vippayutte pañca atthiyā nava natthiyā nava vigate nava avigate nava
translated: there are nine, in terms of the associated nine, in terms of the not-associated five, in terms of the disassociated nine, in terms of the absent nine, in terms of the not-disappeared nine.

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: The reverse order

original: Hetu nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo hetussa nevadassanena nabhāvanāya
analyzed: hetu na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya
translated: A phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing and by cultivating is not a cause for a phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing and by cultivating.

original: pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena
analyzed: pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena
translated: It is a condition, by way of object condition, by way of decisive support condition, by way of support condition, by way of pre-nascence condition, by way of proximity condition, by way of absence condition, by way of disappearance condition, by way of non-disappearance condition.

original: paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: (Condensed.)

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: In terms of not a cause nine, in terms of not an object nine. (Condensed.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: In terms of cause condition, not object three. (Condensed.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: In terms of not cause condition, object nine. (Condensed.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)🔽Hetudukadassanenapahātabbattikaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.🔽3.1.9. Hetuduka, Dassanenapahātabbahetukattika
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba  hetu duka dassanena apahātabba ttikam  hetu duka dassanena apahātabba hetuka ttika
translated: (Just as in the section on the questions in the case of the wholesome triad, the direct order, the reverse order, the direct & reverse order, and the reverse of the direct order have been calculated, so too should it be calculated here.)🔽The section on the triad to be given up by seeing and by cultivating, with cause, is finished.🔽The section on the triad with cause that is to be given up by seeing and by cultivating

original: 3.1.9.1. Dassanenapahātabbahetukapada
analyzed: dassanena apahātabba hetuka pada
translated: ... The section on the term “with cause that is to be given up by seeing”🔽...

original: 3.1.9.1.1–6 Paṭiccādivāra
translated: 3.1.9.1.1–6 The section on conditions, etc.

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The four conditions

original: 1.9.1.7. Pañhāvāra
analyzed: pañhāvāra
translated: …. The section on questions

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The four conditions

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Hetuṁ dassanena pahātabbahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu dassanena pahātabbahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Nahetuṁ dassanena pahātabbahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu dassanena pahātabbahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Hetuṁ dassanena pahātabbahetukañca nahetuṁ dassanena pahātabbahetukañca dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu dassanena pahātabbahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetum dassanena pahātabba hetukam dhammam paṭicca hetu dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  na hetum dassanena pahātabba hetukam dhammam paṭicca na hetu dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  hetum dassanena pahātabba hetukañca na hetum dassanena pahātabba hetukañca dhammam paṭicca hetu dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With regard to the condition being a cause, there are three possibilities for a cause that is to be given up by seeing.🔽With regard to the condition being a cause, there are three possibilities for a cause that is not to be given up by seeing.🔽With regard to the condition being a cause, there are three possibilities for a cause that is to be given up by seeing and a cause that is not to be given up by seeing. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: There are nine possibilities for a cause. There are nine possibilities for an object. … There are nine possibilities for an unobscured neutral state. (Abbreviated.)

original: Naadhipati
analyzed: na adhipati
translated: Non-dominance

original: Hetuṁ dassanena pahātabbahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu dassanena pahātabbahetuko dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetum dassanena pahātabba hetukam dhammam paṭicca hetu dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na adhipati paccayā
translated: With regard to the condition being a cause, there are three possibilities for a cause that is to be given up by seeing. (Abbreviated.)

original: Naadhipatiyā nava, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, navippayutte nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na adhipatiyā nava na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na vippayutte nava saṅkhitta
translated: With respect to non-dominants, there are nine. With respect to prenascent, there are nine. With respect to postnascent, there are nine. With respect to non-kamma, there are nine. With respect to non-result, there are nine. With respect to non-association, there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā nava
translated: With respect to cause, there are nine with respect to non-dominant. (Abbreviated.)

original: Naadhipatipaccayā hetuyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na adhipati paccayāḥ hetuyā nava
translated: With respect to non-dominant, there are nine with respect to cause. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi paccayavāropi nissayavāropi saṁsaṭṭhavāropi sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāraḥ api paccaya vāraḥ api nissaya vāraḥ api sa saṭṭha vāraḥ api sampayutta vāraḥ api paṭicca vāra sadisā vitthāretabbā
translated: (The section on origination should be expanded as for the Dependent Origination.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa
translated: Cause-object

original: Hetu dassanena pahātabbahetuko dhammo hetussa dassanena pahātabbahetukassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa dassanena pahātabba hetukassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A state that is a cause and is to be given up by seeing, is related to a state that is a cause and is to be given up by seeing, as a cause condition. … There are three.

original: Hetu dassanena pahātabbahetuko dhammo hetussa dassanena pahātabbahetukassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa dassanena pahātabba hetukassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ nava saṅkhitta
translated: A state that is a cause and is to be given up by seeing, is related to a state that is a cause and is to be given up by seeing, as an object condition. … There are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… upanissaye nava, āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi, āhāre tīṇi …pe… magge tīṇi, sampayutte nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Paccanīyuddhāra🔽Hetu dassanena pahātabbahetuko dhammo hetussa dassanena pahātabbahetukassa dhammassa🔽ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe upanissaye nava āsevane nava kamme tīṇi āhāre tīṇi pe magge tīṇi sampayutte nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta  paccanīya uddhāra  hetu dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa dassanena pahātabba hetukassa dhammassa  ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: In the clause “With respect to support, nine,” the nine kinds of formations that are objects of the six kinds of consciousness that abandon the unprofitable should be understood as the support condition for the six kinds of consciousness that abandon the unprofitable.🔽In the clause “With respect to prenascence, nine,” the nine kinds of formations that are objects of the six kinds of consciousness that abandon the unprofitable should be understood as the prenascence condition, etc., for the six kinds of consciousness that abandon the unprofitable.🔽In the clause “With respect to presence, nine,” the nine kinds of formations that are objects of the six kinds of consciousness that abandon the unprofitable should be understood as the presence condition, etc., for the six kinds of consciousness that abandon the unprofitable.

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the clause “With respect to non-disappearance, nine,” the nine kinds of formations that are objects of the six kinds of consciousness that abandon the unprofitable should be understood as the non-disappearance condition, etc., for the six kinds of consciousness that abandon the unprofitable.

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: In the clause “With respect to root cause, three,” the three kinds of profitable formations that are root causes should be understood as the root-cause condition for the three kinds of profitable consciousness that have root-cause condition.

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta  yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: In the clause “With respect to object, nine,” the nine kinds of formations that are objects of the three kinds of profitable consciousness that have root-cause condition should be understood as the object condition for the three kinds of profitable consciousness that have root-cause condition.🔽In the clause “With respect to support, nine,” the nine kinds of formations that are objects of the three kinds of profitable consciousness that have root-cause condition should be understood as the support condition for the three kinds of profitable consciousness that have root-cause condition.

original: 3.1.9.2. Bhāvanāyapahātabbahetukapada
analyzed: bhāvanāya apahātabba hetuka pada
translated: In the clause “With respect to prenascence, nine,” the nine kinds of formations that are objects of the three kinds of profitable consciousness that have root-cause condition should be understood as the prenascence condition, etc., for the three kinds of profitable consciousness that have root-cause condition.

original: 3.1.9.2.1–6 Paṭiccādivāra🔽Paccayacatukka
analyzed: 🔽paccaya catukka
translated: In the clause “With respect to presence, nine,” the nine kinds of formations that are objects of the three kinds of profitable consciousness that have root-

original: 1.9.2.7. Pañhāvāra
analyzed: pañhāvāra
translated: 1.9.2.7. The section on questions

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The four causations

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Hetuṁ bhāvanāya pahātabbahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Nahetuṁ bhāvanāya pahātabbahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetum bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukam dhammam paṭicca hetu bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  na hetum bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukam dhammam paṭicca na hetu bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a cause that is to be given up by developing, there is a cause that is to be given up by developing. With a cause that is to be given up by developing, there is a cause that is not to be given up by developing. (Abbreviated.)🔽With a cause that is not to be given up by developing, there is a cause that is not to be given up by developing. (Abbreviated.)

analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: With a cause that is to be given up by developing, there are nine. With an object that is to be given up by developing, there are nine. With predominance that is to be given up by developing, there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Naadhipati🔽Hetuṁ bhāvanāya pahātabbahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā … nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na adhipati  hetum bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukam dhammam paṭicca hetu bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na adhipati paccayā nava
translated: With predominance🔽With a cause that is to be given up by developing, there is a cause that is to be given up by developing. With a cause that is to be given up by developing, there is a cause that is not to be given up by developing. (Abbreviated.)

original: Naadhipatiyā nava, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, navippayutte nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na adhipatiyā nava na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na vippayutte nava saṅkhitta
translated: With predominance that is not to be given up by developing, there are nine. With a condition that is not to be given up by developing, there are nine. With a result that is not to be given up by developing, there are nine. With an action that is not to be given up by developing, there are three. With a nutriment that is not to be given up by developing, there are nine. With a faculty that is not to be given up by developing, there are nine. With a path that is not to be given up by developing, there are nine. With an attainment that is not to be given up by developing, there are nine. With an arising that is not to be given up by developing, there are nine. With a presence that is not to be given up by developing, there are nine. With a non-disappearance that is not to be given up by developing, there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā nava
translated: With a cause that is to be given up by developing, there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Naadhipatipaccayā hetuyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na adhipati paccayāḥ hetuyā nava
translated: As non-predominant condition, nine. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi paccayavāropi nissayavāropi saṁsaṭṭhavāropi sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāraḥ api paccaya vāraḥ api nissaya vāraḥ api sa saṭṭha vāraḥ api sampayutta vāraḥ api paṭicca vāra sadisā vitthāretabbā
translated: (The section on origination should be expanded as for the Dependent Origination, in the same way as the section headed “As root cause” above.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa
translated: Root-cause and object

original: Hetu bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko dhammo hetussa bhāvanāya pahātabbahetukassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A state that is a root-cause to be abandoned by development is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a state that is a root-cause to be abandoned by development … three.

original: Hetu bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko dhammo hetussa bhāvanāya pahātabbahetukassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ nava saṅkhitta

translated: As root-cause, three; as object, nine; as predominance, nine; as proximity, nine; as contiguity, nine; as repetition, nine;🔽as support, nine; as dissociation, nine; as presence, nine; as non-disappearance, nine; as kamma, three; as nutriment, three;

analyzed: tīṇi pe magge tīṇi sampayutte nava pe avigate nava
translated: as faculty, three; as jhāna, three; as path, three; as association, nine; as dissociation, nine; as presence, nine; as absence, nine; as disappearance, nine; as non-disappearance, nine; as root-cause, nine; as Nibbāna, nine. (In brief.)

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: The reverse order

analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ

analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: With a cause as condition, not as object, three. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: Nine by way of cause. Nine by way of object. … Nine by way of absence of object. (In brief.)

original: Nahetu
analyzed: na hetu
translated: Not a cause

original: Nahetuṁ nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetum na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā
translated: A state that is not a cause, that is not to be given up by seeing, that is not to be given up by keeping in being, arises with a state that is not a cause, that is not to be given up by seeing, that is not to be given up by keeping in being, as its condition by way of not a cause condition. (In brief.)

original: Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare
analyzed: na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava na anantare tīṇi na samanantare
translated: One by way of not a cause condition. Three by way of not an object condition. Nine by way of not a dominant condition. Three by way of not an immediately preceding condition.

original: tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane
analyzed: tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane
translated: Three by way of not a proximity condition. Three by way of not a same-as condition. Three by way of not a support condition. Nine by way of not a prenascence condition. Nine by way of not a postnascence condition.

original: nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge
analyzed: nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne eka na magge
translated: Nine by way of not a nutriment condition. Three by way of not a faculty condition. One by way of not a jhāna condition. One by way of not a path condition.

original: ekaṁ, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte nava, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: eka na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte nava no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: One by way of not a association condition. Nine by way of not a dissociation condition. Three by way of not a presence condition. Three by way of not an absence condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi 🔽na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe eka saṅkhitta
translated: Three by way of a cause condition, but not by way of an object condition. (In brief.)🔽One by way of not a cause condition, but by way of an object condition. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi paccayavāropi nissayavāropi saṁsaṭṭhavāropi sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)🔽3.1.9.3.7. Pañhāvāra
analyzed: sahajāta vāraḥ api paccaya vāraḥ api nissaya vāraḥ api sa saṭṭha vāraḥ api sampayutta vāraḥ api paṭicca vāra sadisā vitthāretabbā  pañhāvāra
translated: The Mode of Conveying Questions

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The Fourfold Conditions

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Hetu nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko dhammo hetussa nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbahetukassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A cause that is not to be given up by seeing or by keeping in being is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a state that is not to be given up by seeing or by keeping in being. … There are three. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte🔽nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi, pacchājāte tīṇi,🔽āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi, vipāke nava, āhāre tīṇi, indriye nava, jhāne tīṇi, magge
analyzed: tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte  nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte tīṇi  āsevane nava kamme tīṇi vipāke nava āhāre tīṇi indriye nava jhāne tīṇi magge
translated: In the cause there are three, in the object nine, in the predominance nine, in the proximity nine, in the contiguity nine, in the repetition nine,

original: nava, sampayutte nava, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā nava, natthiyā nava, vigate nava,
analyzed: nava sampayutte nava vippayutte pañca atthiyā nava natthiyā nava vigate nava
translated: in the repetition as condition nine, in the dissociation nine, in the dissociation as condition nine, in the presence nine, in the absence nine, in the disappearance nine,

original: avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: a vigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: in the non-disappearance nine. (In brief.)

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: The Reversal of the Conjunctions

original: Hetu nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko dhammo hetussa nevadassanena nabhāvanāya🔽pahātabbahetukassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: hetu na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya  pahātabba hetukassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A cause that is neither to be given up by seeing nor by cultivating is related to a cause that is neither to be given up by seeing nor by cultivating as object condition, as co-arising condition,🔽as support condition. (In brief.)

original: … upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta  na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: (In brief.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: In the section on root-cause conditions, in the absence of object conditions there are three. (In brief.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on non-root-cause conditions, in the presence of object conditions there are nine. (In brief.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)🔽Hetudukadassanenapahātabbahetukattikaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.🔽3.1.10. Hetuduka, Ācayagāmittika
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba  hetu duka dassanena apahātabba hetuka ttikam niṭṭhita  hetu dukaḥ ācaya gāmittika
translated: (As in the case of the three wholesome kinds of consciousness, the method of calculation should be understood in the same way in the forward order, the reverse order, and the order combining both directions, in the case of the questions.)🔽The section on the three kinds of root-causes that are to be given up by seeing and by cultivating is finished.🔽The section on the three kinds of root-causes that lead to taking up again🔽The section on the three kinds of terms that lead to taking up again

original: 3.1.10.1. Ācayagāmipada🔽3.1.10.1.1–6 Paṭiccādivāra🔽Paccayacatukka
analyzed: ācaya gāmi pada       paccaya catukka
