Pañhāvāra🔽Paccayacatukka🔽Hetu🔽Hetuṁ anāgatārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu anāgatārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Nahetuṁ anāgatārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu anāgatārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba 🔽anāgata ārammaṇa pada 🔽    🔽paccaya catukka 🔽pañhāvāra 🔽paccaya catukka 🔽hetu 🔽hetum anāgata ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca hetu anāgata ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi 🔽na hetum anāgata ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca na hetu anāgata ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: A past object … A future object … A present object … A past and future object … A past and present object … A future and present object … A past, future, and present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past and not-future object … A not-past and not-present object … A not-future and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past and not-future and not-present object … A not-past and not-future and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and not-present object … A not-past, not-future, and

original: Hetuṁ anāgatārammaṇañca nahetuṁ anāgatārammaṇañca dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu anāgatārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetum anāgata ārammaṇam ca na hetum anāgata ārammaṇam ca dhammam paṭicca hetu anāgata ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With a condition as object and without a root cause as object, there is a condition, as condition, for a condition as object and without a root cause as object. … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… kamme nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe kamme nava pe avigate nava
translated: With a root cause, there are nine. With an object, there are nine. … With kamma, there are nine. … With an outlet, there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetu-naadhipati🔽Nahetuṁ anāgatārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu anāgatārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā.🔽Nahetuṁ anāgatārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu anāgatārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā.
analyzed: na hetunā adhipati  na hetum anāgata ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca na hetu anāgata ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā  na hetum anāgata ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca hetu anāgata ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā
translated: Without a root cause, without predominance🔽With a condition as object and without a root cause as object, there is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a condition as object and without a root cause as object.🔽With a condition as object and without a root cause as object, there is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a root cause as object and without a root cause as object.

original: Hetuṁ anāgatārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu anāgatārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetum anāgata ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca hetu anāgata ārammaṇaḥ dhammo uppajjati na adhipati paccayā
translated: With a root cause as object and without a root cause as object, there is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a root cause as object and without a root cause as object. … (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā dve, naadhipatiyā nava, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā dve na adhipatiyā nava na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na magge eka na vippayutte nava saṅkhitta
translated: With a root cause, there are two. With predominance, there are nine. With prior conditionality, there are nine. With post-disappearance, there are nine. With disappearance, there are nine. With kamma, there are three. With ripening, there are nine. With path, there is one. With non-causality, there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā nava
translated: With cause as condition, not as decisive support: nine. (In brief.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe dve
translated: With no cause as condition, as object: two. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi paccayavāropi nissayavāropi saṁsaṭṭhavāropi sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāraḥ api paccaya vāraḥ api nissaya vāraḥ api sa saṭṭha vāraḥ api sampayutta vāraḥ api paṭicca vāra sadisā vitthāretabbā
translated: (The section beginning with “arisen together” should be elaborated in detail as in the Dependent Origination.)

original: Hetvādi
analyzed: hetu ādi
translated: With cause, etc.

original: Hetu anāgatārammaṇo dhammo hetussa anāgatārammaṇassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu anāgata ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa anāgata ārammaṇassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A future object cause is related to a future object cause as a cause condition. … There are three.

original: Hetu anāgatārammaṇo dhammo hetussa anāgatārammaṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … nava.🔽Hetu anāgatārammaṇo dhammo hetussa anāgatārammaṇassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu anāgata ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa anāgata ārammaṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ nava  hetu anāgata ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa anāgata ārammaṇassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa ādhipati sahajāta ādhipati tīṇi
translated: A future object cause is related to a future object cause as an object condition. … There are nine.🔽A future object cause is related to a future object cause as a decisive support condition, as object decisive support and as co-nascent decisive support. … There are three.

original: Nahetu anāgatārammaṇo dhammo nahetussa anāgatārammaṇassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati … tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetu anāgata ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa anāgata ārammaṇassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa ādhipati sahajāta ādhipati tīṇi
translated: A future object cause not related to a future object cause not related to a future object cause as a decisive support condition, as object decisive support and as co-nascent decisive support. … There are three.

original: Hetu anāgatārammaṇo ca nahetu anāgatārammaṇo ca dhammā hetussa anāgatārammaṇassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte🔽nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi, vipāke
analyzed: hetu anāgata ārammaṇo ca na hetu anāgata ārammaṇo ca dhammā hetussa anāgata ārammaṇassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayo ārammaṇa ādhipati tīṇi  tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte  nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava āsevane nava kamme tīṇi vipāke
translated: Causes and causally-related states that have future objects are a condition, as predominance condition, for causes that have future objects. … (Abbreviated.)

original: nava, āhāre tīṇi, indriye nava, jhāne tīṇi, magge nava, sampayutte nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: nava āhāre tīṇi indriye nava jhāne tīṇi magge nava sampayutte nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: (The following are to be elaborated:) In the case of causes, there are three; in the case of objects, nine; in the case of predominance, nine; in the case of proximity, nine; in the case of contiguity, nine; in the case of conascence, nine; in the case of mutuality, nine; in the case of support, nine; in the case of dependence, nine; in the case of association, nine; in the case of dissociation, nine; in the case of presence, nine; in the case of absence, nine; in the case of disappearance, nine; in the case of non-disappearance, nine; in the case of result, nine; in the case of nutriment, three; in the case of faculty, nine; in the case of jhāna, three; in the case of path, nine; in the case of association, nine; … in the case of absence of conflict, nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: The reverse order

original: Hetu anāgatārammaṇo dhammo hetussa anāgatārammaṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu anāgata ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa anāgata ārammaṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo sahajāta paccayena paccayo upanissaya paccayena paccayo saṅkhitta
translated: A future-object cause is a condition, as object condition, for a future-object cause. … It is a condition, as conascence condition, … It is a condition, as decisive-support condition, … (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: (The following are to be elaborated:) In the case of not causes, nine; in the case of not objects, nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: (The following are to be elaborated:) In the case of causes, three; in the case of not objects, three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta  yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: With no condition being a root-cause, there are nine in object. (In brief) …🔽(Just as in the case of the three wholesome kinds of consciousness, the method of working out the permutations should be understood in the same way as in the case of the three kinds of consciousness in the Sensuous-Sphere profitable triad.)🔽… with present object …🔽… with internal and external object …

original: 3.1.19.3. Paccuppannārammaṇapada
translated: … with object to be abandoned by vision of …🔽… with object to be abandoned by development …🔽… with object not to be abandoned …🔽… with object to be abandoned by vision of …

original: 3.1.19.3.1–6 Paṭiccādivāra
translated: … with object to be abandoned by development …🔽… with object not to be abandoned …🔽… with object to be abandoned by vision of …🔽… with object to be abandoned by development …

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: … with object not to be abandoned …🔽… with object to be abandoned by vision of …

original: 1.19.3.7. Pañhāvāra
analyzed: pañhāvāra
translated: … with object to be abandoned by development …🔽… with object not to be abandoned …🔽… with object to be abandoned by vision of …🔽… with object to be abandoned by development …🔽… with object not to be abandoned …🔽… with object to be abandoned by vision of …🔽… with object to be abandoned by development …🔽… with object not to be abandoned …🔽… with object to be abandoned by vision of …🔽… with object to be abandoned by development …🔽… with object not to be abandoned …🔽… with object to be abandoned by vision of …🔽… with object to be abandoned by development …

original: Paccayacatukka🔽Hetu
analyzed: paccaya catukka  hetu
translated: … with object not to be abandoned …🔽… with object to be abandoned by vision of …🔽… with object to be abandoned by development …🔽… with object not to be abandoned …🔽… with object to be abandoned by vision of …

original: Hetuṁ paccuppannārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu paccuppannārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetum paccuppanna ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca hetu paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: … with object to be abandoned by development …🔽… with object not to be abandoned …🔽… with object to be abandoned by vision of …🔽… with object to be abandoned by development …🔽… with object not to be abandoned …🔽… with object to be abandoned by vision of …

original: Nahetuṁ paccuppannārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu paccuppannārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetum paccuppanna ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca na hetu paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: … with object to be abandoned by development …🔽… with object not to be abandoned …🔽… with object to be abandoned by vision of …🔽… with object to be abandoned by development …🔽… with object not to be abandoned …🔽… with object to be abandoned by vision of …🔽… with object to be abandoned by development …

original: Hetuṁ paccuppannārammaṇañca nahetuṁ paccuppannārammaṇañca dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu paccuppannārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetum paccuppanna ārammaṇam ca na hetum paccuppanna ārammaṇam ca dhammam paṭicca hetu paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: … with object not to be abandoned …🔽… with object to be abandoned by vision of

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… kamme nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe kamme nava pe avigate nava
translated: With nine in terms of cause. With nine in terms of object. With nine in terms of predominance. … With nine in terms of kamma. … With nine in terms of the undeﬁled. (In brief.)

original: Nahetu-naadhipati🔽Nahetuṁ paccuppannārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu paccuppannārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: na hetunā adhipati  na hetum paccuppanna ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca na hetu paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati
translated: Neither as a cause nor as a predominance condition:🔽With a condition being a state that has arisen with an object that has arisen, a state that has arisen without a cause arises.

original: nahetupaccayā. Nahetuṁ paccuppannārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu paccuppannārammaṇo🔽dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā.
analyzed: na hetu paccayā na hetum paccuppanna ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca hetu paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā
translated: With a condition being a state that has arisen with an object that has arisen, a state that has arisen with a cause arises.

original: Hetuṁ paccuppannārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu paccuppannārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetum paccuppanna ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca hetu paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ dhammo uppajjati na adhipati paccayā
translated: With a condition being a state that has arisen with an object that has arisen, a state that has arisen with a cause arises, not as a predominance condition. (In brief.)

original: Nahetuyā dve, naadhipatiyā nava, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā dve na adhipatiyā nava na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na jhāne eka na magge eka na vippayutte nava saṅkhitta
translated: With two in terms of neither as a cause nor as a predominance condition. With nine in terms of neither as a prior nor as a subsequent condition. With nine in terms of neither as a support nor as a nutriment condition. With nine in terms of neither as a faculty nor as a power condition. With three in terms of neither as kamma nor as a decisive support condition. With nine in terms of neither as jhāna nor as a path condition. With nine in terms of neither as an association nor as a dissociation condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā nava
translated: With nine in terms of a cause condition, not as a predominance condition. (In brief.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe dve
translated: With two in terms of a non-cause condition, as an object condition. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi paccayavāropi nissayavāropi saṁsaṭṭhavāropi sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāraḥ api paccaya vāraḥ api nissaya vāraḥ api sa saṭṭha vāraḥ api sampayutta vāraḥ api paṭicca vāra sadisā vitthāretabbā
translated: (The section on origination should be elaborated in the same way as the section on condition.)

original: Hetvādi
analyzed: hetu ādi
translated: Cause, etc.

original: Hetu paccuppannārammaṇo dhammo hetussa paccuppannārammaṇassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa paccuppanna ārammaṇassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A cause that has a present object is a condition, as cause, for a cause that has a present object. … three.🔽A cause that has a present object is a condition, as object, for a cause that has a present object. … nine.🔽A cause that has a present object is a condition, as dominant, for a cause that has a present object. … three.

original: Hetu paccuppannārammaṇo dhammo hetussa paccuppannārammaṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … nava.
analyzed: hetu paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa paccuppanna ārammaṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ nava
translated: A cause that has a present object is a condition, as object, for a cause that has a present object. … nine.

original: Hetu paccuppannārammaṇo dhammo hetussa paccuppannārammaṇassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati … tīṇi.🔽Nahetu paccuppannārammaṇo dhammo nahetussa paccuppannārammaṇassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa paccuppanna ārammaṇassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati tīṇi 🔽na hetu paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa paccuppanna ārammaṇassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa ādhipati sahajāta ādhipati tīṇi
translated: A cause that has a present object is a condition, as dominant, for a cause that has a present object. … three.

original: Hetu paccuppannārammaṇo ca nahetu paccuppannārammaṇo ca dhammā hetussa paccuppannārammaṇassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccuppanna ārammaṇo ca na hetu paccuppanna ārammaṇo ca dhammā hetussa paccuppanna ārammaṇassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayo ārammaṇa adhipati tīṇi
translated: Conditions that are causes and have a presently arisen object and conditions that are not causes and have a presently arisen object are a dominant condition for conditions that are causes and have a presently arisen object. … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte🔽nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi, vipāke
analyzed: tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte  nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava āsevane nava kamme tīṇi vipāke
translated: In the section on cause, there are three. In the section on object, there are nine. In the section on predominance, there are nine. In the section on proximity, there are nine. In the section on contiguity, there are nine. In the section on conascence, there are nine.

original: nava, āhāre tīṇi, indriye nava, jhāne tīṇi, magge sampayutte nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: nava āhāre tīṇi indriye nava jhāne tīṇi magge sampayutte nava pe avigate nava
translated: In the section on mutuality, there are nine. In the section on support, there are nine. In the section on dependence, there are nine. In the section on association, there are nine. … (Abbreviated.) In the section on non-causality, there are nine. In the section on non-object, there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: The reverse order

original: Hetu paccuppannārammaṇo dhammo hetussa paccuppannārammaṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa paccuppanna ārammaṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: A condition that is a cause and has a presently arisen object is a condition, as object condition, for a condition that is a cause and has a presently arisen object. … It is a condition, as co-nascence condition, … It is a condition, as support condition, … (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on non-cause, there are nine. In the section on non-object, there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: With root-cause as condition, non-object: three. (In brief.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: With non-root-cause as condition, object: nine. (In brief.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)🔽Hetudukaatītārammaṇattikaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.🔽3.1.20. Hetuduka, Ajjhattattika🔽3.1.20.1. Ajjhattapada
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba  hetu duka atīta ārammaṇa ttikam niṭṭhita  hetu duka ajjhatta ttika  ajjhatta pada
translated: (As the permutation series in the case of the questions in the chapter on the wholesome triad is done forwards and backwards and forwards and backwards, so should it be done here.)🔽The section on the past triad with root-cause is finished.🔽With root-cause, internal triad🔽Internal base

original: 3.1.20.1.1–6 Paṭiccādivāra

analyzed: paccaya catukka

translated: Root-cause🔽With a root-cause internal condition, an internal condition arises by way of root-cause condition … three.🔽With a non-root-cause internal condition, a non-root-cause internal condition arises by way of root-cause condition … three.

original: Hetuṁ ajjhattañca nahetuṁ ajjhattañca dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu ajjhatto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

translated: With a root-cause internal and a non-root-cause internal condition, an internal condition arises by way of root-cause condition … three. (In brief.)

translated: As with cause, so with non-cause.🔽As with cause, so with object, etc. (as in §11).🔽As with cause, so with non-cause.🔽As with cause, so with non-cause.

translated: As with cause, so with object, etc. (as in §11).🔽As with cause, so with non-cause.🔽As with cause, so with object, etc. (as in §11).🔽As with cause, so with non-cause.

translated: As with cause, so with non-cause.🔽As with cause, so with object, etc. (as in §11).

original: Nahetuyā dve, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare🔽tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane🔽nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge
analyzed: na hetuyā dve na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava na anantare tīṇi na samanantare  tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane  nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne eka na magge
translated: Two are not root-cause. Three are not object. Nine are not predominance. Three are not proximity. Three are not contiguity.🔽Three are not association. Three are not support. Three are not prenascence. Nine are not postnascence. Nine are not nutriment.🔽Nine are not faculty. One is not jhāna. One is not path.🔽

original: ekaṁ, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte nava, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: eka na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte nava no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: With non-cause as condition, two. With non-object as condition, three. With non-dominance as condition, nine. With non-antecedent as condition, three. With non-consequent as condition, three. With non-conascence as condition, three. With non-purity as condition, three. With non-defeat as condition, three. (In brief.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: With cause as condition, with non-object as condition, three. (In brief.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe dve
translated: With non-cause as condition, with object as condition, two. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi paccayavāropi nissayavāropi saṁsaṭṭhavāropi sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)🔽Hetvādi
analyzed: sahajāta vāraḥ api paccaya vāraḥ api nissaya vāraḥ api sa saṭṭha vāraḥ api sampayutta vāraḥ api paṭicca vāra sadisā vitthāretabbā  hetu ādi
translated: (The section on origination should be elaborated in the same way as the section on condition.)🔽With cause as condition, internally …

original: Hetu ajjhatto dhammo hetussa ajjhattassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu ajjhattaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa ajjhattassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: With cause as condition, an internal states is related to an internal states as cause condition … three.

original: Hetu ajjhatto dhammo hetussa ajjhattassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … nava.
analyzed: hetu ajjhattaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa ajjhattassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ nava
translated: A cause that is an internal condition is related to a cause that is an internal condition as a condition being a object condition … nine.

original: Hetu ajjhatto dhammo hetussa ajjhattassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati … tīṇi.🔽Nahetu ajjhatto dhammo nahetussa ajjhattassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu ajjhattaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa ajjhattassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati tīṇi  na hetu ajjhattaḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa ajjhattassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati tīṇi
translated: A cause that is an internal condition is related to a cause that is an internal condition as a condition being a dominant condition: as the object-predominance and as the co-nascence-predominance … three.🔽A cause that is an internal condition is related to a cause that is an internal condition as a condition being a dominant condition: as the object-predominance and as the co-nascence-predominance … three.

original: Hetu ajjhatto ca nahetu ajjhatto ca dhammā hetussa ajjhattassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu ajjhattaḥ ca na hetu ajjhattaḥ ca dhammā hetussa ajjhattassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayo ārammaṇa adhipati tīṇi
translated: A cause that is an internal condition and a cause that is an external condition are related to a cause that is an internal condition as a condition being a dominant condition: as the object-predominance … three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte
analyzed: tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte
translated: In the case of cause, there are three; in the case of object, nine; in the case of predominance, nine; in the case of proximity, nine; in the case of contiguity, nine; in the case of conascence,

original: nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi, pacchājāte tīṇi,
analyzed: nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte tīṇi
translated: nine; in the case of mutuality, nine; in the case of support, nine; in the case of dependence, nine; in the case of prenascence, three; in the case of postnascence, three;

original: āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi, vipāke nava, āhāre tīṇi, indriye nava, jhāne tīṇi, magge
analyzed: āsevane nava kamme tīṇi vipāke nava āhāre tīṇi indriye nava jhāne tīṇi magge
translated: in the condition of development, there are nine; in the condition of kamma, there are three; in the condition of result, there are nine; in the condition of nutriment, there are three; in the condition of faculty, there are nine; in the condition of absorption, there are three; in the condition of path,

original: nava, sampayutte nava, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā nava, natthiyā nava, vigate nava,
analyzed: nava sampayutte nava vippayutte pañca atthiyā nava natthiyā nava vigate nava

original: avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: a vigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: in the condition of non-disappearance, there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: Reversal

original: Hetu ajjhatto dhammo hetussa ajjhattassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu ajjhattaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa ajjhattassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: An internal condition is a condition, as support condition, for an internal condition that is a cause … for a condition that is a conascent cause … for a condition that is a support cause. (Abbreviated.)

analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi

analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta

analyzed: na hetum bahiddhā dhammam paṭicca na hetu bahiddhā dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā na hetum bahiddhā dhammam paṭicca hetu bahiddhā dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā saṅkhitta  na hetuyā dve na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava na anantare tīṇi na samanantare  tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane
translated: In dependence on an internal dhamma that is not a cause, an internal dhamma that is not a cause arises. In dependence on an internal dhamma that is not a cause, an internal dhamma that is a cause arises. (Abbreviated.)

analyzed: nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne eka na magge
translated: In dependence on not a cause, two; in dependence on not an object, three; in dependence on not predominance, nine; in dependence on not proximity, three; in dependence on not contiguity, three; in dependence on not mutuality, three; in dependence on not support, three; in dependence on not prenascence, nine; in dependence on not postnascence, nine; in dependence on not nutriment, nine; in dependence on not faculty, three; in dependence on not jhāna, one; in dependence on not path, one; in dependence on not association, nine; in dependence on not dissociation, nine; in dependence on not presence, nine; in dependence on not absence, one; in dependence on not disappearance, nine; in dependence on not non-disappearance, nine; in dependence on not cleansing, nine; in dependence on not non-cleansing, nine.🔽In dependence on not a cause, two; in dependence on not an object, three; in dependence on not predominance, nine; in dependence on not proximity, three; in dependence on not contiguity, three; in dependence on not mutuality, three; in dependence on not support, three; in dependence on not prenascence, nine; in dependence on not postnascence, nine; in dependence on not nutriment, nine; in dependence on not faculty, three; in dependence on not jhāna, one; in dependence on not path, one; in dependence on not association, nine; in dependence on not dissociation, nine; in dependence on not presence, nine; in dependence on not absence, one; in dependence on not disappearance, nine; in dependence on not non-disappearance, nine; in dependence on not cleansing, nine; in dependence on not non-cleansing, nine.

analyzed: eka na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte nava no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: with one, with three in the non-related, with nine in the unrelated, with three in the not-supported, with three in the not-surrounded. (In brief.)

analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi

analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe dve

analyzed: hetu ādi

analyzed: hetu bahiddhā dhammaḥ hetussa bahiddhā dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi

translated: An external root phenomenon is a condition, as object condition, for an external root phenomenon. … There are nine.

original: Hetu bahiddhā ca nahetu bahiddhā ca dhammā hetussa bahiddhā dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

translated: Factors that are causes and external to that cause are a condition, as dominant condition, for a factor that is external to that cause. (Three ways.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi,
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi
translated: (In brief:) As to cause, there are three; as to object, nine; as to predominance, nine. … As to support, nine; as to prenascence, three;

original: pacchājāte tīṇi, āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi, vipāke nava, āhāre tīṇi, indriye nava,
analyzed: pacchājāte tīṇi āsevane nava kamme tīṇi vipāke nava āhāre tīṇi indriye nava
translated: as to postnascence, three; as to repetition, nine; as to kamma, three; as to kamma-result, nine; as to nutriment, three; as to faculty, nine;

original: jhāne tīṇi, magge sampayutte nava, vippayutte pañca …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: jhāne tīṇi magge sampayutte nava vippayutte pañca pe avigate nava
translated: as to jhāna, three; as to path, nine; as to association, nine; as to dissociation, five. … As to fading away, nine. (In brief.)

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: The reverse order

original: Hetu bahiddhā dhammo hetussa bahiddhā dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu bahiddhā dhammaḥ hetussa bahiddhā dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo sahajāta paccayena paccayo upanissaya paccayena paccayo saṅkhitta
translated: A factor that is a cause and external to that cause is a condition, as object condition, for a factor that is a cause and external to that cause. … As conascence condition, … As support condition, … (In brief.)

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: As to non-cause, nine; as to non-object, nine. (In brief.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: As to cause condition, non-object, three. (In brief.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: As to non-cause condition, object, nine. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: With nine as condition: with nine as object: with nine as dominant: … (In brief.)

original: Nahetu-naadhipati🔽Nahetuṁ ajjhattārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu ajjhattārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: na hetunā adhipati  na hetum ajjhatta ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca na hetu ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati
translated: Neither as root cause nor as dominant

original: nahetupaccayā. Nahetuṁ ajjhattārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu ajjhattārammaṇo dhammo🔽uppajjati nahetupaccayā.
analyzed: na hetu paccayā na hetum ajjhatta ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca hetu ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ dhammo  uppajjati na hetu paccayā
translated: A state that is neither a root cause nor a dominant condition and that is an internal object has a condition that is a state that is neither a root cause nor a dominant condition and that is an internal object.🔽It has a condition that is a state that is a root cause and that is an internal object.

original: Hetuṁ ajjhattārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu ajjhattārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetum ajjhatta ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca hetu ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ dhammo uppajjati na adhipati paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: A state that is a root cause and that is an internal object has a condition that is a state that is a root cause and that is an internal object. It has a condition that is a state that is a root cause and that is an internal object, but not as a dominant condition. (In brief.)

original: Nahetuyā dve, naadhipatiyā nava, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā dve na adhipatiyā nava na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na jhāne eka na magge eka na vippayutte nava saṅkhitta
translated: With two as condition: with nine as condition: with nine as prior and with nine as subsequent: with nine as nutriment: with three as kamma: with nine as result: with one as path: with one as object: with nine as object. (In brief.)

original: Hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā nava 🔽na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe dve
translated: With nine as root cause: with nine as dominant: with two as object: (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi paccayavāropi nissayavāropi saṁsaṭṭhavāropi sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)

translated: (The section on origination should be elaborated in the same way as the section on condition.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… upanissaye āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi, vipāke nava, āhāre tīṇi, indriye nava, jhāne tīṇi, magge nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

translated: In the case of cause, there are three; in the case of object, nine; in the case of predominance, nine; … in the case of decisive support, nine; in the case of nutriment, three; in the case of faculty, nine; in the case of jhana, three; in the case of path, nine; … in the case of non-remorse, nine. (In brief) …

original: Paccanīyuddhāra

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

translated: With non-cause as condition, nine. (In brief.)

(Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā cha, anantare nava …pe… upanissaye nava, āsevane🔽nava, kamme tīṇi, vipāke nava, āhāre tīṇi, indriye nava, jhāne tīṇi, magge sampayutte
analyzed: na hetu bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa bahiddhā ārammaṇassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayo sahajāta ādhipati tīṇi  hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā cha anantare nava pe upanissaye nava āsevane  nava kamme tīṇi vipāke nava āhāre tīṇi indriye nava jhāne tīṇi magge sampayutte
translated: A state without root-cause that is external is a condition, as dominant condition, for a state without root-cause that is external. … (Abbreviated.)

original: nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on root-cause, there are three. In the section on object, there are nine. In the section on predominance, there are six. In the section on jhāna, there are three. In the section on path, there are nine. … In the section on association, there are nine. … In the section on non-disappearance, there are nine. original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: The reverse order

original: Hetu bahiddhārammaṇo dhammo hetussa bahiddhārammaṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

translated: A state that is root-cause and is external is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is root-cause and is external. … It is a condition, as arising together condition, … It is a condition, as support condition, … (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on root-cause, there are nine. In the section on object, there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on object, there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)🔽Hetudukaajjhattārammaṇattikaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba  hetu duka ajjhatta ārammaṇa ttikam niṭṭhita
translated: (As in the case of the three wholesome roots, the questions in the section on the triplets beginning with “with root-cause” should be calculated in direct and reverse order, as in the case of the section on the triad of skill in the aggregates, etc.)🔽The section on the triplets beginning with “with root-cause” and with the internal as object is finished.

original: 3.1.22. Hetuduka, Sanidassanasappaṭighattika
analyzed: hetu duka sani dassana sappaṭigha ttika
translated: … with root-cause, with object visible, with impinging

original: 3.1.22.1. Anidassanasappaṭighapada
analyzed: a nidassana sa paṭigha pada
translated: … without object visible, with impinging

original: 3.1.22.1.1–6 Paṭiccādivāra🔽Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: … the section on the tetrad beginning with “with cause”

original: Hetvādi
analyzed: hetu ādi
translated: The fourfold dependent origination

original: Nahetuṁ anidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu anidassanasappaṭigho dhammo🔽uppajjati hetupaccayā … adhipatipaccayā … sahajātapaccayā … aññamaññapaccayā … nissayapaccayā🔽… kammapaccayā … vipākapaccayā … āhārapaccayā … indriyapaccayā … jhānapaccayā … maggapaccayā
analyzed: na hetum a nidassana sa paṭigham dhammam paṭicca na hetu a nidassana sa paṭighaḥ dhammaḥ  uppajjati hetu paccayā adhipati paccayā sahajāta paccayā aññamañña paccayā nissaya paccayā  kamma paccayā vipāka paccayā āhāra paccayā indriya paccayā jhāna paccayā magga paccayā
translated: With root-cause, without object visible, with impinging

original: … vippayuttapaccayā … atthipaccayā … avigatapaccayā.
analyzed: vippayutta paccayā atthi paccayā avigata paccayā
translated: With root-cause, without object visible, with impinging dhammas are related to root-cause condition, … to predominance condition, … to conascence condition, … to mutuality condition, … to support condition, … to kamma condition, … to result condition, … to nutriment condition, … to faculty condition, … to jhāna condition, … to path condition, … to association condition, … to presence condition, … to absence condition, … to disappearance condition, … to non-disappearance condition.

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: Pure

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, adhipatiyā ekaṁ, sahajāte ekaṁ, aññamaññe ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, kamme
analyzed: hetuyāḥ eka adhipatiyāḥ eka sahajāte eka aññamaññe eka nissaye eka kamme
translated: With root-cause: one. With predominance: one. With conascence: one. With mutuality: one. With support: one. With kamma: one.

original: ekaṁ, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, jhāne ekaṁ, magge ekaṁ, vippayutte ekaṁ,
analyzed: eka vipāke eka āhāre eka indriye eka jhāne eka magge eka vippayutte eka
translated: in relation to result … in relation to nutriment … in relation to faculty … in relation to absorption … in relation to path … in relation to the unassociated …

original: atthiyā ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: atthiyā eka avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: in relation to presence … in relation to non-disappearance. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā ekaṁ (sabbe paccayā kātabbā) …pe… novigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe eka na adhipatiyā ekam sabbe paccayā kātabbā pe no vigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: in relation to non-cause … in relation to non-object … in relation to non-predominance … (all the paccayas should be done) … in relation to non-disappearance. (Abbreviated.)

original: Sahajātādi
analyzed: sahajāta ādi
translated: Conascence, etc.

original: Nahetu anidassanasappaṭigho dhammo nahetussa anidassanasappaṭighassa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: na hetu anidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa anidassana sappaṭighassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena
translated: A non-cause, non-sign, impeding phenomenon is related to a non-cause, non-sign, impeding phenomenon as an immediately preceding condition …

original: paccayo … aññamaññapaccayena paccayo … nissayapaccayena paccayo … atthipaccayena🔽paccayo … avigatapaccayena paccayo. (Sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: paccayaḥ aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ atthi paccayena  paccayaḥ avigata paccayena paccayaḥ sabbattha eka
translated: as a mutually-dependent condition … as a support condition … as a presence condition …🔽as a non-disappearance condition. (Everywhere one.)🔽The section on non-sign, non-impeding.

original: 3.1.22.2. Anidassanaappaṭighapada🔽3.1.22.2.1–6 Paṭiccādivāra
analyzed: an idassana ap paṭigha pada
translated: The section on conditionality, etc.

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The four condition tetrads

original: 1.22.2.7. Pañhāvāra
analyzed: pañhāvāra
translated: The section on questions

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The four condition tetrads

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Hetuṁ anidassanaappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu anidassanaappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetum anidassana appaṭigham dhammam paṭicca hetu anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: A non-sign, non-impeding cause phenomenon is related to a non-sign, non-impeding cause phenomenon as a cause condition … three …

original: Nahetuṁ anidassanaappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu anidassanaappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Hetuṁ anidassanaappaṭighañca nahetuṁ anidassanaappaṭighañca dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu anidassanaappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetum anidassana appaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na hetu anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  hetum anidassana appaṭigham ca na hetum anidassana appaṭigham ca dhammam paṭicca hetu anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an object that is not a root cause, not visible, and without resistance, there is an object that is not a root cause, not visible, and without resistance. (Three times.)🔽With an object that is a root cause, not visible, and without resistance, and with an object that is not a root cause, not visible, and without resistance, there is an object that is a root cause, not visible, and without resistance. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… kamme nava, vipāke nava, āhāre nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe kamme nava vipāke nava āhāre nava pe avigate nava
translated: In the section on root cause there are nine. In the section on object there are nine. … In the section on kamma there are nine. In the section on result there are nine. In the section on nutriment there are nine. … In the section on the unformed there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetu-naadhipati🔽Nahetuṁ anidassanaappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu anidassanaappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: na hetunā adhipati  na hetum anidassana appaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na hetu anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati
translated: Not a root cause, not a dominant condition🔽With an object that is not a root cause, not visible, and without resistance, there is an object that is not a root cause, not visible, and without resistance.

original: nahetupaccayā. Nahetuṁ anidassanaappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu anidassanaappaṭigho🔽dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā.
analyzed: na hetu paccayā na hetum anidassana appaṭigham dhammam paṭicca hetu anidassana appaṭighaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā
translated: With an object that is not a root cause, not visible, and without resistance, there is an object that is a root cause, not visible, and without resistance.🔽With an object that is a root cause, not visible, and without resistance, there is an object that is not a root cause, not visible, and without resistance. (Three times.)

original: Hetuṁ anidassanaappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu anidassanaappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetum anidassana appaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na hetu anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an object that is a root cause, not visible, and without resistance, there is an object that is not a root cause, not visible, and without resistance. (Three times.)

original: Hetuṁ anidassanaappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu anidassanaappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetum anidassana appaṭigham dhammam paṭicca hetu anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammo uppajjati na adhipati paccayā
translated: With an object that is a cause and is not visible and is not resistant, there is a condition, as a cause condition, by way of the cause condition, for a resultant, a functional, and an unconditioned dhamma. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā dve, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava …pe… napurejāte nava, napacchājāte
analyzed: na hetuyā dve na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava pe na purejāte nava na pacchājāte
translated: With an object that is not a cause, there are two. With an object that is not a decisive support, there are three. With an object that is not a dominant, there are nine. … With an object that is not a prenascence, there are nine. With an object that is not a postnascence, there are nine.

original: nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ,
analyzed: nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na āhāre eka na aindriye eka
translated: With an object that is not a repetition, there are nine. With an object that is not a kamma, there are three. With an object that is not a result, there are nine. With an object that is not nutriment, there is one. With an object that is not a faculty, there is one.

original: najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte nava, nonatthiyā tīṇi,
analyzed: na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte nava no natthiyā tīṇi
translated: With an object that is not a jhāna, there is one. With an object that is not a path, there is one. With an object that is not associated, there are three. With an object that is not dissociated, there are nine. With an object that is not a condition, there are three.

original: novigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na u vigate tīṇi
translated: With an object that is not a non-condition, there are three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: With a cause condition, there are three as object conditions. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe dve
translated: With a non-cause condition, there are two as object conditions. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi paccayavāropi nissayavāropi saṁsaṭṭhavāropi sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāraḥ api paccaya vāraḥ api nissaya vāraḥ api sa saṭṭha vāraḥ api sampayutta vāraḥ api paṭicca vāra sadisā vitthāretabbā
translated: (The method of treatment in the case of the co-nascence, mutuality, support, dependence, and association sections should be expanded in accordance with the treatment in the case of the condition section.)

original: Hetvādi
analyzed: hetu ādi
translated: As to cause, etc.

original: Hetu anidassanaappaṭigho dhammo hetussa anidassanaappaṭighassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa anidassana appaṭighassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A cause that is not visible and is not resistant is related to a cause that is not visible and is not resistant as a condition being a cause … three.

original: Hetu anidassanaappaṭigho dhammo hetussa anidassanaappaṭighassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … nava.
analyzed: hetu anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa anidassana appaṭighassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ nava
translated: A cause that is not visible and is not resistant is related to a cause that is not visible and is not resistant as a condition being a object … nine.

original: Hetu anidassanaappaṭigho dhammo hetussa anidassanaappaṭighassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati … tīṇi.🔽Nahetu anidassanaappaṭigho dhammo nahetussa anidassanaappaṭighassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati sahajātādhipati … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa anidassana appaṭighassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati tīṇi  na hetu anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa anidassana appaṭighassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati tīṇi
translated: A cause that is not visible and is not resistant is related to a cause that is not visible and is not resistant as a condition being a dominant condition—as object-predominant condition, as support-predominant condition, as proximity-predominant condition, as separation-predominant condition, as association-predominant condition, as dissociation-predominant condition, as presence-predominant condition, as absence-predominant condition, as disappearance-predominant condition, as manifestation-predominant condition … three.🔽A cause that is not visible and is not resistant is related to a cause that is not visible and is not resistant as a condition being a dominant condition—as object-predominant condition, as support-predominant condition, as proximity-predominant condition, as separation-predominant condition, as association-predominant condition, as dissociation-predominant condition, as presence-predominant condition, as absence-predominant condition, as disappearance-predominant condition, as manifestation-predominant condition … three.

original: Hetu anidassanaappaṭigho ca nahetu anidassanaappaṭigho ca dhammā hetussa anidassanaappaṭighassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu anidassana appaṭigho ca na hetu anidassana appaṭighaḥ ca dhammā hetussa anidassana appaṭighassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayo ārammaṇa adhipati tīṇi
translated: A cause that is not visible and is not resistant and a cause that is not visible and is not resistant are related to a cause that is not visible and is not resistant as a condition being a dominant condition—as object-predominant condition … three.

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte🔽nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi, pacchājāte tīṇi,🔽āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi, vipāke nava, āhāre tīṇi, indriye nava, jhāne tīṇi, magge
analyzed: tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte  nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte tīṇi  āsevane nava kamme tīṇi vipāke nava āhāre tīṇi indriye nava jhāne tīṇi magge
translated: As condition, three; as object, nine; as dominance, nine; as proximity, nine; as contiguity, nine; as decisive support, nine; as prenascence, nine; as postnascence, nine;

original: nava, sampayutte nava, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā nava, natthiyā nava, vigate nava,
analyzed: nava sampayutte nava vippayutte pañca atthiyā nava natthiyā nava vigate nava
translated: as repetition, nine; as nutriment, three; as faculty, nine; as jhāna, three; as path, nine; as association, nine; as dissociation, five; as presence, nine; as absence, nine; as disappearance, nine;

original: avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: a vigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: as non-disappearance, nine. (In brief.)

original: Paccanīyuddhāra🔽Hetu anidassanaappaṭigho dhammo hetussa anidassanaappaṭighassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra  hetu anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa anidassana appaṭighassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo sahajāta paccayena paccayo upanissaya paccayena paccayo saṅkhitta  na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta  hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: The reverse order

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: A non-evident, non-inconstant condition is a condition, as object condition, as decisive support condition, as prenascence condition, as postnascence condition, as repetition condition, as nutriment condition, as faculty condition, as jhāna condition, as path condition, as association condition, as dissociation condition, as presence condition, as absence condition, as disappearance condition, as non-disappearance condition, as root cause condition, as non-root cause condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as faculty condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition, as non-great source condition, as great source condition

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: (As in the case of the three profitable thoughts, the questions in the Mode of Conveying Questions are to be worked out in the Modes of Conveying a Fourfold Array, a Threepath Array, and a Twofold Array, and in the Mode of Conveying a Reversal.)

original: Hetudukasanidassanasappaṭighattikaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: hetu duka sani dassana sa paṭigha ttikam
translated: The Mode of Conveying a Fourfold Array is finished.
